$schema.description: Property to add schema property in json

OPTION.description: Program Control, Execution, Analysis and Plot Option Data (Required)

WTIN.description: Geometric, Weight, Balance and Inertia Data (Required)

FUSEIN.description:
Fuselage Design Data
 (Required if XL=0. and NFUSE>0 or IFITE=3 in Namelist $WTIN)
 (All defaults = 0. unless otherwise noted)

CONFIN.description:
Configuration Geometric Ratios, Objective Function Definition, 
and Design Variables (Required)

AERIN.description:
Aerodynamic Input Options and Data for Internal Aerodynamic
Calculations and Approximate Takeoff and Landing (Required)

ARIDE.description:
Data for Modification of EDET Aerodynamic Tables 
(Used only if MODARO = 1 in Namelist $AERIN)
 Note: Not available in the XFlops Graphical User Interface.

The namelist contains replacement data for the aerodynamic data
tables in EDET.The data can be modified on an element by
element basis, or entire arrays may be replaced.The arrays
which can be modified with their maximum dimensions are listed
below.  See the EDET documentation and listing for definitions
and current values.

COSTIN.description: Cost Calculation Data (Used only if ICOST = 1 in Namelist $CONFIN)

ENGDIN.description:
Engine Deck Control, Scaling and Usage Data
(Required if IANAL = 3 or 4 or INENG = 1 in Namelist $OPTION)

ENGINE.description:
Data for Engine Deck Generation Using the Internal Cycle Analysis Module 
(Required if IGENEN = 1 or -2 in Namelist $ENGDIN.Note - Some 
variables in this Namelist are logical, others are not.)

ENGINEDECK.description:
Tabular Engine Performance Data 
(Required in this position if IGENEN = 0,
and from an external file if IGENEN = -1)

NACELL.description:
Data for Computation of Nacelle Weights
(Required only if NGINWT in Namelist $ENGINE is not equal to 0)

MISSIN.description:
Performance Controls and Factors and Mission Segment Definition 
(Required if IANAL = 3 in Namelist $OPTION)

MISSIONDEFINITION.description:
Main Mission Flight Sequence Definition
(Required if IANAL = 3 in Namelist $OPTION)

AERODYNAMICDATA.description:
User Supplied Aerodynamic Drag Polar Data
(Input only if MYAERO > 0 in Namelist $AERIN.If MYAERO = 3,
Namelist $RFHIN is input instead of Cards 1 through 4 in that
position to define the lift dependent drag.)

ASCLIN.description:
Scaling Data for Lift Independent Drag 
(Input only if MYAERO = 2.  All defaults = 0.unless otherwise noted)

TOLIN.description:
Detailed Takeoff and Landing Data 
(Used only if ITAKOF, ILAND and/or NOPRO = 1 in Namelist $OPTION)

PROIN.description:
Input Data for Detailed Takeoff and Climb Profile for Nois
Calculations (Used only if NOPRO = 1 in Namelist $OPTION.)

SEGIN.description:
Data Defining Each Segment in the Detailed Climb Profile
(Required for each noise profile segment if NOPRO = 1 in
Namelist $OPTION)

NOISIN.description:
Data for Noise Calculations
(Used only if NOISE = 1 in Namelist $AERIN.All defaults = 0.
unless otherwise noted)

SYNTIN.description:
Optimization Control and Constraint Limits
(Required only for IOPT = 3 in Namelist $OPTION.)

RERUNS.description: Group of namelist to be repeated vua RERUN

allOf.description: Program Control, Execution, Analysis and Plot Option Data (Required)

MPRINT.description:
Master print control
 =1, Normal output for all analyses(Default)
 =0, Print only 3-5 line summary for each analysis Usually used only for contour plots(IOPT = 4)

IOPT.description:
=1, Analysis - Analyze input configuration(Default)
=2, Parametric variation - Perform a matrix of analyses varying 
            the design variables as indicated in Namelist $CONFIN
= 3, Optimization - Optimize the configuration using the design 
            variables as indicated in Namelist $CONFIN.Namelist $SYNTIN must 
            be included with NDD > 0 in that namelist.
= 4, Contour or thumbprint plot - Prepare data for plotting contours 
            of OBJ versus 2 parametrically varying design variables (See Namelist $CONFIN)

IANAL.description:
=1, Compute weights
=2, Compute weights and aerodynamics
=3, Full analysis including mission performance (Default)
=4, Propulsion system only - Provides the capability to optimize an engine 
            at its design point or to perform a parametric variation using the engine design 
            variables(See Namelist $CONFIN)

INENG.description:
=1, Engine data is read in or generated even if IANAL = 1 or 2
=0, Engine data is used only if IANAL = 3 or 4 (Default)

ITAKOF.description:
=1, Detailed takeoff performance will be calculated (Namelist $TOLIN required)
=0, Otherwise(Default)

ILAND.description:
= =1, Detailed landing performance will be calculated (Namelist $TOLIN required)
 =0, Otherwise(Default)

NOPRO.description:
=1, Detailed takeoff and climb profiles will be generated for noise calculations
            (Namelists $TOLIN, $PROIN and $SEGIN required)
=0, Otherwise(Default unless NOISE = 1)

NOISE.description:
=0, No noise data will be generated(Default)
=1, Noise footprint data for takeoff and climbout will be generated 
            (Namelist $NOISIN required) This will set NOPRO = 1
=2, Noise data will be generated only for the final analysis for an optimization run

ICOST.description:
=1, Calculate costs(Namelist $COSTIN required)
=0, No costs are calculated(Default)

IFITE.description:
=0, Use transport weight equations and FAA transport 
            takeoff and landing procedures and requirements (Default)
=1, Use fighter/attack weight equations and 
            MIL-STD-1793 takeoff and landing procedures and requirements
=2, Use general aviation weight equations - currently incomplete
=3, Use blended wing body weight equations and FAA transport takeoff 
            and landing procedures and requirements.Requires Namelist $FUSEIN to define the fuselage.

CNFILE.description: Contour or thumbprint plot data file name (Default = 'FLPPLOT')

IXFL.description:
=1, Cruise, mission and takeoff and landing plot files will be generated
=0, Otherwise (Default)

MSFILE.description: Mission summary data file name(Default = 'MSMPLOT' - this name is used by XFLOPS)

CRFILE.description:
Cruise schedule summary data file name (Default = 'CRUPLOT') 
IFLAG(Namelist $MISSIN) must be greater than 0. 
If IFLAG is greater than 1, separate climb and 
descent profiles may also be plotted by XFLOPS.

TOFILE.description: Takeoff and landing aerodynamic and thrust data file name(Default = 'TOLPLOT')

NPFILE.description:
Takeoff and Climb Profile File for Noise Calculations
 =1, Detailed Takeoff and climb profiles will be
output on file NOFILE for use with ANOPP preprocessor
 =0, Otherwise(Default)

NOFILE.description: Takeoff and climb profile data file name (Default = 'NPROF')

LPFILE.description:
=1, Detailed approach and landing profiles will be 
            output on file LOFILE for use with ANOPP preprocessor
=0, Otherwise(Default)

LOFILE.description: Approach and landing profile data file name (Default = 'LPROF')

IPOLP.description:
=0, No drag polar plots(Default)
=1, Prepare data on APFILE(Unit 8) for plotting
            drag polars at existing(internal) Mach numbers
=2, Drag polar plot data will be at NMACH input Mach numbers

APFILE.description: Drag polar plot data file name(Default = 'POLPLOT')

NMACH.description: Number of input Mach numbers for IPOLP = 2 (Maximum = 20, Default = 0)

PMACH.description: Input Mach numbers for IPOLP = 2, NMACH values (Default = 0.)

IPLTTH.description:
=2, Engine data suitable for plotting will be 
            output on file THFILE for the final scaled or optimized engine
=1, Engine data suitable for plotting will be 
            output on file THFILE for the initial engine
=0, Otherwise(Default)

THFILE.description:
Engine plot data file name(Default = 'THRPLOT') 
This file is in the same format as the input Engine 
Deck(See EIFILE in Namelist $ENGDIN) and includes 
all sorted and filled engine points.It can be used 
for input for subsequent runs if it does not exceed 
the size limit.

IPLTHS.description:
=1, Prepare data on HSFILE (Unit 18) for plotting 
            design history for design variables, objectives,
            constraints, and other data of interest during
            an optimization run or parametric variation.
=0, Otherwise(Default)

IPLTPS.description:
Number of excess power(Ps) and/or load factor(Nz)
contour plot data sets to be generated and output on
PSFILE(Default = 0, Maximum = 10)

PSFILE.description: Excess power and load factor plot data file name (Default = 'PSPLOT')

PLTNZ.description:
< 0., Plot load factor(Nz) contours(Default) 
Otherwise, load factor(Nz) at which excess power 
            (Ps) contours will be plotted

PLTPC.description:
Engine power setting parameter
 < 1., Fraction of maximum available thrust 
 = 1., Maximum thrust(Default)
 > 1., Power setting for engine deck 
(3. would indicate the third highest thrust)

IPSTDG.description:
Number of store drag schedule(see Namelist $MISSIN) 
to be applied to the Ith plot(Default = 0)

PLTWT.description:
Fixed weight, lb
 There are three ways to input the weight at which the plot data
are to be generated.They are listed in the order of precedence. 
(Default = Ramp Weight)

IPLTSG.description:
Weight at start of mission segment IPLTSG is used
 There are three ways to input the weight at which the plot data
are to be generated.They are listed in the order of precedence. 
(Default = Ramp Weight)

PLTFM.description:
Fuel multiplier or fraction of fuel burned
 There are three ways to input the weight at which the plot data
are to be generated.They are listed in the order of precedence. 
(Default = Ramp Weight)

allOf.description: Geometric, Weight, Balance and Inertia Data (Required)

DGW.description: Design gross weight - fraction of GW (see $CONFIN) or weight, lb (Default = 1.0)

VMMO.description: Maximum operating Mach number (Default = VCMN, Namelist $CONFIN)

NWREF.description:
The number of the reference weight for percentage weight output.Typical values are:
 39 - Ramp Weight (Default)
 37 - Zero Fuel Weight
 33 - Operating Weight Empty
 26 - Weight Empty

CGREFL.description:
Reference length for percentage C.G. location 
output, in. (Default = XL*12., fuselage length)

CGREFX.description: X - location of start of reference length, in. (Default =0.)

MYWTS.description:
=0, Weights will be computed (Default)
= 1, Otherwise(See User-Specified Weights, Namelist $MISSIN)

WPAINT.description: Weight of paint for all wetted areas, lb/sq.ft.

IALTWT.description:
=1, Alternate weight equations for some components will be used(Special option)
= 0, Normal FLOPS weight equations will be used

ISPOWE.description:
= 0, Normal FLOPS weight equations will be used
= 1, Special equation for Operating Weight Empty will be used:

OWE = SPWTH* THRUST + SPWSW* SW + SPWGW* GW + SPWCON

Structures group weights will be scaled to meet the calculated OWE.

SPWTH.description:
Multiplier for thrust/engine in special equation for
            Operating Weight Empty, lb/lb(Default = 2.2344)

SPWTH = (PODscalar + dOEWscalar) * AIRFLOWref / SLSTHRUSTref

SPWSW.description:
Multiplier for wing area in special equation for 
Operating Weight Empty, lb/ft2(Default = 9.5)

SPWGW.description:
Multiplier for gross weight in special equation for 
Operating Weight Empty, lb/lb(Default = .104087)
 
 SPWGW = (MTOWscalar + OEWgrowth* MTOWgrowth) / (1. + MTOWgrowth)

SPWCON.description:
Constant weight term in special equation for 
Operating Weight Empty, lb(Default = 38584.)
 
 SPWCON = OEWuncycled - MTOWscalar* MTOWuncycled - WINGscalar* SWref - (PODscalar + dOEWscalar)*AIRFLOWref

SPAN.description: Wing span (optional, see $CONFIN - SW and AR)

DIH.description: Wing dihedral (positive) or anhedral (negative) angle, deg

FLAPR.description:
Flap ratio -- ratio of total movable wing surface area 
(flaps, elevators, spoilers, etc.) to wing area (Default = .333)

GLOV.description: Total glove and bat area beyond theoretical wing, sq.ft.

VARSWP.description:
Fraction of wing variable sweep weight penalty
 = 0., Fixed-geometry wing
 = 1., Full variable-sweep wing

FCOMP.description:
Decimal fraction of amount of composites used in wing structure
 = 0., No composites
 = 1., Maximum use of composites, approximately 
equivalent to FRWI1=.6, FRWI2=.83, FRWI3=.7 
(Not necessarily all composite)
 This only applies to the wing.Use override 
parameters for other components such as FRHT=.75,
FRVT=.75, FRFU=.82, FRLGN=.85, FRLGM=.85, FRNA=.8

FAERT.description:
Decimal fraction of amount of aeroelastic 
tailoring used in design of wing
 = 0., No aeroelastic tailoring
 = 1., Maximum aeroelastic tailoring

FSTRT.description:
Wing strut-bracing factor
 = 0., No wing strut
 = 1., Full benefit from strut bracing

ETAW.description:
Wing station location - fraction of semispan or
distance from fuselage centerline, ft.  Typically,
goes from 0. to 1.  Input fixed distances (> 1.1)
are not scaled with changes in span.

CHD.description:
Chord length - fraction of semispan or actual chord, 
ft.Actual chord lengths(>5.) are not scaled.

SWL.description:
Sweep of load path, deg.  Typically parallel to rear 
spar tending toward max t/c of airfoil.The Ith 
value is used between wing stations I and I+1.

ETAE.description:
Engine locations - fraction of semispan or distance 
from fuselage centerline, ft.Actual distances are 
not scaled with changes in span.NEW/2 values are 
input(Default = .3,.6,0.,0., Maximum of 4 values)

PCTL.description: Fraction of load carried by defined wing (Default = 1.)

PDIST.description:
Pressure distribution indicator (Default = 2.)
 = 0., Input distribution - see below
 = 1., Triangular distribution
 = 2., Elliptical distribution
 = 3., Rectangular distribution

SHT.description:
Horizontal tail theoretical area, sq ft 
(Overridden by HTVC in Namelist $CONFIN if HTVC > 0.)

SWPHT.description:
Horizontal tail 25% chord sweep angle, deg
(Default = SWEEP, Namelist $CONFIN)

ARHT.description:
Horizontal tail theoretical aspect ratio 
(Default = AR/2, Namelist $CONFIN)

TRHT.description:
Horizontal tail theoretical taper ratio
(Default = TR, Namelist $CONFIN)

TCHT.description:
Thickness-chord ratio for the horizontal tail
(Default = TCA, Namelist $CONFIN)

HHT.description:
Decimal fraction of vertical tail span where
horizontal tail is mounted 
 = 0. for body mounted(Default for transports with
all engines on the wing and for fighters)
 = 1. for T tail(Default for transports with
multiple engines on the fuselage)

SVT.description:
Vertical tail theoretical area (per tail), sq ft
(Overridden by VTVC in Namelist $CONFIN if VTVC > 0.)

SWPVT.description:
Vertical tail sweep angle at 25% chord, deg
(Default = SWPHT)

ARVT.description:
Vertical tail theoretical aspect ratio
(Default = ARHT/2)

TRVT.description:
Vertical tail theoretical taper ratio
(Default = TRHT)

TCVT.description:
Thickness-chord ratio for the vertical tail
(Default = TCHT)

SFIN.description: Vertical fin theoretical area, sq ft

SWPFIN.description: Vertical fin sweep angle at 25% chord, deg

SWPCAN.description: Canard sweep angle at 25% chord, deg

XL.description:
Fuselage total length, ft
If XL is not input for a passenger transport,
Namelist $FUSEIN is required, and Flops will
calculate the fuselage length, width and depth and
the length of the passenger compartment.

XLP.description:
Length of passenger compartment, ft 
(Default is internally computed)

XMLG.description:
Length of extended main landing gear oleo, in.
(Default is computed internally)

XNLG.description:
Length of extended nose landing gear oleo, in.
(Default is computed internally)

WLDG.description:
Design landing weight, lb (if WRATIO is input
in Namelist $AERIN, WLDG = GW* WRATIO)
See Namelist $AERIN for WRATIO defaults.

MLDWT.description:
= 1, The design landing weight is set to the end of
            descent weight for the main mission plus DLDWT.
            Use only if IRW = 1 in Namelist $MISSIN.
=  0, The design landing weight is determined by WLDG
            above or WRATIO in Namelist $AERIN. (Default)
= -1, The initial design landing weight determined by
            WLDG above or WRATIO in Namelist $AERIN is not
            scaled with changes in the gross weight.

DLDWT.description: Delta landing weight for MLDWT = 1, lb (Default = 0.)

CARBAS.description:
Carrier based aircraft switch, affects weight of
flight crew, avionics and nose gear
 = 1., Carrier based
 = 0., Land based(Default)

THRSO.description:
Rated thrust of baseline engine as described in 
Engine Deck, lb (Default = THRUST, see $CONFIN)

WENG.description:
Weight of each baseline engine or bare engine if
WINL and WNOZ (below) are supplied, lb (Default =
THRSO / 5.5 for transports and THRSO / 8 for fighters)
If WENG > 0.0 but < 5.0, it is a scale factor applied to internally computed weight

EEXP.description:
Engine weight scaling parameter (Default = 1.15)
W(Engine) = WENG* (THRUST/THRSO)**EEXP
If EEXP is less than 0.3,
W(Engine) = WENG + (THRUST-THRSO)*EEXP

WINL.description:
Inlet weight for baseline engine if not included in
WENG above(Default = 0., Included in WENG)

EINL.description:
Inlet weight scaling exponent (Default = 1.)
W(Inlet) = WINL* (THRUST/THRSO)**EINL

WNOZ.description:
Nozzle weight for baseline engine if not included in
WENG above(Default = 0., Included in WENG)

ENOZ.description:
Nozzle weight scaling exponent (Default = 1.)
W(Nozzle) = WNOZ* (THRUST/THRSO)**ENOZ

XNAC.description:
Average length of baseline engine nacelles, ft
Scaled by SQRT(THRUST/THRSO)

DNAC.description:
Average diameter of baseline engine nacelles, ft
Scaled by SQRT(THRUST/THRSO)

WPMISC.description:
Additional miscellaneous propulsion system weight, lb
or fraction of engine weight if < 1.
This is added to the engine control and starter
weight and may be overridden if WPMSC is input.

NUMDEK.description: Number of engine decks to be input (Default = 1, Maximum = 2)

NEALT.description: Number of engines for alternate propulsion system (Default = 0, no alternate propulsion system)

ALTTHR.description: Rated thrust per engine for alternate propulsion system, lb

ALTEWT.description: Weight per engine for alternate propulsion system, lb

POWWT.description: System weight for alternate propulsion system, lb

ITYPFL.description:
Fuel type indicator (NUMDEK values, Default = 0,0)
 = 0, Normal, burnable fuel(hydrocarbons)
 = 1, Fuel is not burned(electric, etc.)

FULWMX.description:
Total fuel capacity of wing, lb
The default is internally calculated from:
 
 FULWMX = FWMAX * (TCA * SW**2) / SPAN * (1 - TR / ((1+TR)**2))
  Where the default value of FWMAX is 23.  If FULWMX 
is input < 50, it is interpreted as FWMAX and the
above equation is used.This equation is also used 
for scaling when the wing area, t/c, aspect ratio,
or taper ratio is varied or optimized.

FULDEN.description:
Fuel density ratio for alternate fuels compared to
jet fuel(typical density of 6.7 lb/gal), used in the
calculation of FULWMX(if FULWMX is not input) and in
the calculation of fuel system weight. (Default = 1.)

FULFMX.description:
otal fuel capacity of fuselage (wing "carry-thru"
structure and/or in fuselage tanks), lb

IFUFU.description:
=1, Fuselage fuel capacity is adjusted to meet the
            required fuel capacity for the primary mission.
            Use only if IRW = 1 in Namelist $MISSIN, and use
            with care - some passengers can't swim.
= 0, Fuselage fuel capacity is fixed. (Default)

FULAUX.description:
Auxiliary (external) fuel tank capacity, lb
(Fighters only)

FMXTOT.description:
Total fuel capacity of the aircraft including wing,
fuselage and auxiliary tanks, lb.  Used in generating
payload-range diagram - see Namelist $RERUN.
(Default = FULWMX + FULFMX + FULAUX)

BATWT.description: Storage system weight for alternate energy source, lb

POWMAX.description: Storage system capacity for alternate energy source

MBATWT.description:
=1, Modify POWMAX and BATWT to meet mission requirements(Default)
= 0, Otherwise
Note: This is used only in mixed mode operation with
            IRW = 1 where the free segment is fuel-burning.For
            single mode operation, IRW controls resizing for both
            fuel burning and non-fuel burning propulsion systems.

POWRES.description:
Reserve storage system capacity for alternate energy
source.Typically used with MBATWT.  When used for
single mode operation, this is in addition to other reserves.

FSWREF.description:
Reference wing area for FUELRF, ft**2
(Default = SW in Namelist $CONFIN)

BPP.description:
Weight of baggage per passenger, lb(Default = 35.,
or 40. if DESRNG in Namelist $CONFIN > 900.,
or 44. if DESRNG > 2900.)

CARGF.description:
Military cargo aircraft floor factor
 = 0., Passenger transport(Default)
 = 1., Military cargo transport

CARGOW.description:
Cargo carried in wing, lb(Weight of
wing-mounted external stores for fighters)

CARGOF.description:
Cargo(other than passenger baggage) carried in
fuselage, lb(Fuselage external stores for fighters)

PAYLMX.description:
Maximum payload for the aircraft, including
passengers and cargo, lb.Used in generating
payload-range diagram - see Namelist $RERUN.
(Default = (NPF+NPB+NPT)*(WPPASS+BPP)+CARGOF+CARGOW)

FRWI.description:
Total wing weight - fixed weight overrides FRWI1, 
FRWI2, FRWI3 below, scale factor is cumulative

FRWI1.description:
First term in wing weight equation - loosely 
corresponds to bending material weight

FRWI2.description:
Second term in wing weight equation - loosely 
corresponds to control surfaces, spars and ribs

FRWI3.description:
Third term in wing weight equation - miscellaneous,
just because it's there

FRWI4.description:
Fourth term in wing weight equation - aft body for  
BWB configurations - see IFITE = 3

FRFU.description:
Fuselage weight(Note: For BWB fuselages, IFITE= 3,
the fuselage is assumed to be composite.)

FRNA.description: Total weight of nacelles and/or air induction system

WPMSC.description:
Weight of miscellaneous propulsion systems such
as engine controls, starter and wiring

WARM.description:
Armament Group weight - includes thermal protection 
system or armor and fixed weapons (Default = 0.)

WAI.description:
Transports: Anti-icing Group weight
Fighters:   Auxiliary gear

WSRV.description:
Transports: Passenger service weight
Fighters: Ammunition and nonfixed weapons weight

WCON.description:
Transports: Cargo and baggage container weight
Fighters:   Miscellaneous operating items weight
If < 0.5, as a fraction of Gross Weight

WFLCRB.description:
Total weight of flight crew and baggage
(Defaults:  Transports    - 225.*NFLCR
Fighters      - 215.*NFLCR
Carrier-based - 180.*NFLCR)

WSTUAB.description:
Total weight of cabin crew and baggage
(Default = 155.* NSTU + 200.* NGALC)

EWMARG.description:
Empty weight margin (Special Option) - delta weight
added to Weight Empty.If abs(EWMARG) < 5., it is 
interpreted as a fraction of calculated Weight Empty.
May be positive or negative (Default = 0.)

CGEF.description: Longitudinal C.G.of two forward mounted engines

CGEA.description: Longitudinal C.G.of one or two aft mounted engines

CGARM.description:
Longitudinal C.G.of armament group - includes
thermal protection system or armor and fixed weapons
(Default = CGF)

CGCW.description: Longitudinal C.G.of wing cargo or external stores

CGCF.description: Longitudinal C.G.of fuselage cargo or external stores

CGFWF.description: Longitudinal C.G.of wing fuel in full condition

CGPOW.description: Longitudinal C.G.of system weight for alternate engines

CGBAT.description: Longitudinal C.G.of storage system for alternate energy source

CGAIS.description: Longitudinal C.G. of air induction system

CGAMMO.description: Longitudinal C.G.of ammunition and nonfixed weapons

INRTIA.description:
=1, Aircraft inertias will be calculated
= 0, Otherwise(Default)

ZEF.description: Vertical C.G.of two forward mounted engines (optional)

YEF.description:
Lateral C.G.of two forward mounted engines 
(optional, may be input as a fraction of the semispan)

ZEA.description: Vertical C.G.of one or two aft mounted engines (optional)

YEA.description:
Lateral C.G.of one or two aft mounted engines 
(optional, may be input as a fraction of the semispan)

ZBW.description: Lowermost point of wing root airfoil section

ZRVT.description:
Vertical datum line(Water Line) of vertical tail 
theoretical root chord(optional, if blank assume 
at maximum height of fuselage)

YMLG.description: Lateral C.G.of extended main landing gear

YFUSE.description: Lateral C.G.of outboard fuselage if there is more than one fuselage

YVERT.description: Lateral C.G.of outboard vertical tail if there is more than one vertical tail

SWTFF.description:
Gross fuselage wetted area, sq ft 
(Default = internally computed)

TCR.description:
Wing root thickness-chord ratio 
(Default = TOC(1) or TCA in $CONFIN)

TCT.description:
Wing tip thickness-chord ratio 
(Default = TOC(NETAW) or TCA in $CONFIN)

INCPAY.description:
=1, Include passengers, passenger baggage, and cargo
             in the fuselage and contents for inertia calculations.
             = 0, For inertia calculations, all payload
            (passengers, passenger baggage, and cargo) are
            placed in "tanks" like the fuel. (Default)

ITANK.description:
Number of tanks for inertia calculations - fuel
tanks plus payload tanks(Default = 1, Maximum = 40)

TX.description: x coordinate of the centroid of the Ith tank

TY.description: y coordinate of the centroid of the Ith tank

TZ.description: z coordinate of the centroid of the Ith tank

TL.description:
Length of the Ith tank 
(optional, used only in calculating I0's which 
may be negligible)

TW.description:
Width of the Ith tank 
(optional, used only in calculating I0's which 
may be negligible)

TD.description:
Depth of the Ith tank 
(optional, used only in calculating I0's which 
may be negligible)

TF.description:
Weight of fuel(or payload) in Ith tank for Jth
fuel condition, lb

IFITE.description:
=0, Use transport weight equations and FAA transport 
            takeoff and landing procedures and requirements (Default)
=1, Use fighter/attack weight equations and 
            MIL-STD-1793 takeoff and landing procedures and requirements
=2, Use general aviation weight equations - currently incomplete
=3, Use blended wing body weight equations and FAA transport takeoff 
            and landing procedures and requirements.Requires Namelist $FUSEIN to define the fuselage.

FPITCH.description: Seat pitch for the first class passengers

NFABR.description: Number of first class passengers abreast

BPITCH.description: Seat pitch for business class passengers

NBABR.description: Number of business class passengers abreast

TPITCH.description: Seat pitch for tourist class passengers

NTABR.description: Number of tourist class passengers abreast

allOf.description:
Fuselage Design Data
 (Required if XL=0. and NFUSE>0 or IFITE=3 in Namelist $WTIN)
 (All defaults = 0. unless otherwise noted)

FPITCH.description: Seat pitch for the first class passengers

NFABR.description: Number of first class passengers abreast

BPITCH.description: Seat pitch for business class passengers

NBABR.description: Number of business class passengers abreast

TPITCH.description: Seat pitch for tourist class passengers

NTABR.description: Number of tourist class passengers abreast

OSSPAN.description:
Outboard semispan, ft (Default = ETAW(NETAW), required
if ETAW(NETAW) is less than or equal to 1.0 and
IFITE = 3 and NETAW > 1)
 This variable is used if a detailed wing outboard
panel (See Detailed Wing Data in Namelist $WTIN)
is being added to a BWB fuselage.

TIPCHD.description:
Wing tip chord, ft (Default = 0.06*Wing span)
 This variable is used if the wing outer panel is
defined as a trapezoid attached to the BWB cabin.

NESOB.description:
Wing eta station number for outboard side of body.
 If this variable is greater than 1, the detailed wing
definition is assumed to include the cabin.  Weight
calculations for the outboard wing start at this eta
station. (Default = 0, the detailed outboard wing is
added to the cabin as indicated above.)

ACABIN.description:
Fixed area of passenger cabin for blended wing body
transports, sq ft (Default is internally computed
based on passenger data)

XLW.description:
Fixed length of side wall, ft
 This is the outboard wall of the passenger cabin
and is used to define the outboard wing root chord.

XLWMIN.description:
Minimum side wall length, ft
 The typical value of 38.5 ft is based on a required
maximum depth at the side wall of 8.25 ft divided by
a fuselage thickness/chord ratio of 0.15 and 70
percent of the resulting wing root chord of 55 ft.

SWPLE.description:
Sweep angle of the leading edge of the passenger
cabin, deg (Default = 45 deg)

CRATIO.description:
Fixed ratio of the centerline length to the cabin
width (XLP/WF)

TCSOB.description:
Fuselage thickness/chord ratio at side of body
(Default = TCF)

RSPCHD.description:
Rear spar percent chord for BWB at fuselage
centerline (Default = 70 percent)

RSPSOB.description:
Rear spar percent chord for BWB fuselage at side
of body (Default = RSPCHD)

allOf.description:
Configuration Geometric Ratios, Objective Function Definition, 
and Design Variables (Required)

DESRNG.description:
Design range, n.mi. (or endurance, min.  See INDR
in Namelist $MISSIN)  Required - if IRW = 2 in
 Namelist $MISSIN, the range is computed, but a
reasonable guess must still be input.

WSR.description:
>  0., required wing loading.  Do not set WSR > 0
during optimization or if wing area is being
varied.
 =-1., interpret SW as wing loading for parametric
variation.  Do not use for optimization.

TWR.description:
>  0., required total thrust-weight ratio.  Do not
set TWR > 0 during optimization or if thrust
is being varied.
 =-1., interpret THRUST as thrust-weight ratio for
parametric variation.  Do not use for
optimization.

HTVC.description:
Modified horizontal tail volume coefficient.
* If HTVC > 0., SHT = HTVC * SW * Sqrt(SW/AR) / XL
(This overrides any input value for SHT)
 SHT will be recalculated if SW or AR are changed
during optimization or parametric variation.
* If HTVC = 1., the horizontal tail volume
coefficient calculated from the input values of
 SHT, SW, AR and XL will be maintained.
* If HTVC = 1. and SHT = 0. (which is the default), a
reasonable value for HTVC will be calculated, and,
then, SHT will be calculated as above.

VTVC.description:
Modified vertical tail volume coefficient.
* If VTVC > 0., SVT = VTVC * SW * Sqrt(SW*AR) / XL
(This overrides any input value for SVT)
 SVT will be recalculated if SW or AR are changed
during optimization or parametric variation.
* If VTVC = 1., the vertical tail volume coefficient
calculated from the input values of SVT, SW, AR and
 XL will be maintained.
* If VTVC = 1. and SVT = 0. (which is the default), a
reasonable value for VTVC will be calculated, and,
then, SVT will be calculated as above.
* Note: If NVERT = 0, VTVC is set to 0.

PGLOV.description:
Fixed ratio of glove area to wing area (GLOV/SW)
 If PGLOV > 0., GLOV will change if SW changes

FIXSPN.description:
Special Option - Fixed wing span, ft.  If the wing
area is being varied or optimized, the wing aspect
ratio will be adjusted to maintain a constant span.
(Default = not used)

FIXFUL.description:
Special Option - Fixed mission fuel, lb.  Allows
specification of mission fuel.  Since this fuel is
normally a fall out (what's left over after OWE and
payload are subtracted from the gross weight), this
option requires iterating on the gross weight until
the mission fuel = FIXFUL.  Gross weight cannot be
an active design variable or used in a parametric
variation, and IRW must be 2 in Namelist $MISSIN.
(Default = not used)

OFG.description: Objective function weighting factor for gross weight

OFF.description:
Objective function weighting factor for mission fuel
(Default = 1.)

OFM.description:
Objective function weighting factor for
 Mach*(L/D), should be negative to maximize

OFR.description:
Objective function weighting factor for Range,
should be negative to maximize.

OFC.description: Objective function weighting factor for Cost

OSFC.description:
Objective function weighting factor for Specific Fuel
 Consumption at the engine design point.  Generally
used only for engine design cases (IANAL = 4).

OFNOX.description: Objective function weighting factor for NOx emissions

OFNF.description:
Objective function weighting factor for flyover noise
(used primarily for contour plots)

OFNS.description:
Objective function weighting factor for sideline
noise (used primarily for contour plots)

OFNFOM.description:
Objective function weighting factor for noise figure
of merit

OAREA.description:
Objective function weighting factor for area of noise
footprint (not implemented)

OFH.description:
Objective function weighting factor for hold time
for segment NHOLD (See Namelist $MISSIN)

GW.description:
Ramp weight, lb (Required.  If IRW = 1, a good
initial guess must be input.)

THRUST.description:
Maximum rated thrust per engine, lb, or thrust-
weight ratio if TWR = -1. (Default = THRSO in
 Namelist $WTIN if TWR = 0.)

SW.description:
Reference wing area, sq ft, or wing loading
(GW/SW) if WSR = -1. (See below)

SWEEP.description:
Quarter-chord sweep angle of the wing, degrees
(Required)

VARTH.description:
Thrust derating factor for takeoff noise
 Fraction of full thrust used in takeoff
(Default = 1. Use full thrust)

ROTVEL.description:
Rotation velocity for takeoff noise abatement
(default is minimum required to meet takeoff
performance constraints)

PLR.description:
Thrust fraction after programmed lapse rate
(default thrust is specified in each segment)

ETIT.description:
Engine design point turbine entry temperature, deg R
if IENG (Namelist $ENGINE) < 100, otherwise
Design power, hp (Default = 180.)

EOPR.description:
Overall pressure ratio
if IENG (Namelist $ENGINE) < 100, otherwise
Propeller diameter, ft. (Default = 6.375)

EFPR.description:
Fan pressure ratio (Turbofans only)
if IENG (Namelist $ENGINE) < 100, otherwise
Integrated design lift coefficient (Default = 0.569)

EBPR.description:
Bypass ratio (Turbofans only)
if IENG (Namelist $ENGINE) < 100, otherwise
Activity factor (Default = 87.6)

ETTR.description:
Engine throttle ratio defined as the ratio of the
maximum allowable turbine inlet temperature divided
by the design point turbine inlet temperature.  If
 ETTR is greater than ETIT, it is assumed to be
the maximum allowable turbine inlet temperature.
If IENG (Namelist $ENGINE) > 100
Maximum propeller shaft speed, RPM (Default = 2700.)

EBLA.description: Blade angle for fixed pitch propeller, deg

allOf.description:
Aerodynamic Input Options and Data for Internal Aerodynamic
Calculations and Approximate Takeoff and Landing (Required)

MYAERO.description:
Controls type of user-supplied aerodynamic data   
 =0, Drag polars are computed internally (Default)
 =1, Aerodynamic Data will be read in
 =2, Scalable Aerodynamic Data will be input      
(Namelist $ASCLIN required)
 =3, Special parabolic Aerodynamic Data format    
(Namelist $RFHIN required)
 =4, Input CDTAB and CDPA vectors directly
(See special option below)

IWAVE.description:
Controls Wave Drag Data input type
 =1, Input Wave Drag Data will be formatted
 =0, Otherwise (Default, no wave drag or it is input
in Namelist $ASCLIN)

FWAVE.description:
Wave drag factor - multiplies input values of wave
drag from formatted aerodynamic data or Namelist
$ASCLIN (Default = 1.)

ITPAER.description:
Aerodynamic data interpolation switch
 =1, Linear - Use if aerodynamic data is irregular.
 This is usually indicated by strange climb,
descent or cruise profiles.
 =2, Parabolic (Default)
 =3, Parabolic interpolation for CL, linear
interpolation for Mach number and altitude.

IBO.description:
Format indicator for input aerodynamic matrices
 =1, A new line is started for each Mach number for
 Cards 4 and for each altitude for Cards 8
 =0, Data is continuous, 10 to a line (Default)

T.description:
T is a special format array containing all drag polar data
  T(1) defines array sizes = NX(number of X points) * 1000 + NY(number of Y points).
  T(2) to T(1 + NY) are y values
  T(2 + NY) is the first X value
  T(3 + NY) to T(2 + NY* 2) are the first Z values
  The X - Z pattern is repeated NX times
  
  NX0NY  Y1   Y2   Y3   Y4   Y5. . .
  =  X1 Z11  Z12  Z13  Z14  Z15. . .
  =  X2 Z21  Z22  Z23  Z24  Z25. . .
  =  X3 Z31  Z32  Z33  Z34  Z35. . .
  =   .   .    .    .    .     . . .

CDTAB.description:
Drag due to lift array where X is the Mach number and
 Y is the lift coefficient

CDPA.description:
Lift independent drag array where X is the altitude
and Y is the Mach number

CAM.description:
Maximum camber at 70% semispan, percent of local
chord

SBASE.description:
Aircraft base area (total exit cross-section area
minus inlet capture areas for internally mounted
engines), sq ft

AITEK.description:
Airfoil technology parameter.  Limiting values are:
 =1., Conventional wing (Default)
 =2., Advanced technology wing

MODARO.description:
=1, Data tables in EDET are to be modified,
Namelist $ARIDE will be read in
=0, Otherwise (Default)

FCLDES.description:
Fixed design lift coefficient.  If input, overrides
design CL computed by EDET.

FMDES.description:
Fixed design Mach number.  If input, overrides
design Mach number computed by EDET.

XLLAM.description:
=0., Turbulent flow assumed
=1., Laminar Flow (LF) assumed as indicated below

TRUH.description:
Percent LF horizontal tail upper surface
surface

TRUV.description: Percent LF vertical tail upper surface

TRLH.description: Percent LF horizontal tail lower surface

TRLV.description: Percent LF vertical tail lower surface

MIKE.description:
Switch for span efficiency reduction for extreme
taper ratios
 =1, A span efficiency factor (EO) is calculated
based on wing taper ratio and aspect ratio.
 =0, Otherwise (Default, EO = 1.)

E.description:
Span efficiency factor for wing (Default = 1.0)
> 0.3, EO = EO * E (See above)
<= 0.3, EO = EO + E

VAPPR.description:
Maximum allowable landing approach velocity, kts
(Default = 150.)

FLTO.description:
Maximum allowable takeoff field length, ft
(Default = 12000.)

FLLDG.description:
Maximum allowable landing field length, ft
(Default = FLTO)

CLLDM.description:
Maximum CL in landing configuration
(Default = 3. or 1.69 CLAPP if it is input)

DRATIO.description:
Takeoff and landing air density ratio
(Default = 1., sea level standard day)

ELODSS.description:
Lift-Drag ratio for second segment climb
(Default is internally computed)

ELODMA.description:
Lift-Drag ratio for missed approach climb
(Default is internally computed)

THRSS.description:
Thrust per baseline engine for second segment
climb, lb (Default = THRUST, Namelist $CONFIN)

THRMA.description:
Thrust per baseline engine for missed approach
climb, lb (Default = THRSS)

THROFF.description:
Thrust per baseline engine for takeoff, lb
(Default = THRSS)

allOf.description:
Data for Modification of EDET Aerodynamic Tables 
(Used only if MODARO = 1 in Namelist $AERIN)
 Note: Not available in the XFlops Graphical User Interface.

The namelist contains replacement data for the aerodynamic data
tables in EDET.The data can be modified on an element by
element basis, or entire arrays may be replaced.The arrays
which can be modified with their maximum dimensions are listed
below.  See the EDET documentation and listing for definitions
and current values.
Cost Calculation Data (Used only if ICOST = 1 in Namelist $CONFIN)

AC.description: Airconditioning total pack air flow, lb/min

APUFLW.description: Auxiliary power unit flow rate, lb/min

APUSHP.description: Auxiliary power unit shaft horsepower, hp

EPR.description: Engine pressure ratio at sea level static

FARE.description: Fare, dollars per passenger per statute mile (Triggers calculation of return on investment)

FPPFT.description: Spares factor for prototype and flight test engines

HYDGPM.description: Gallon per minute flow of hydraulic pumps

IACOUS.description: Acoustic treatment in nacelle  =0, No  =1, Yes

IBODY.description: Body type indicator  =0, Narrow body  = 1, Wide body

ICIRC.description: Circuit indicator - fire detection  =1, Single circuit  = 2, Dual circuit

ICOREV.description: Thrust reverser  =0, No core reverser  =1, Core reverser

ICOSTP.description:
Type of cost calculation desired
 =1, Life cycle cost(LCC)
 =2, Acquisition cost
 = 3, Direct operating cost(DOC)
 =4, Indirect operating cost(IOC)
 =5, Operating cost only (DOC + IOC - Depreciation)

INOZZ.description:
Nozzle type indicator  =1, Cascade or target type reverser with translating sleeve
 =2, Simple target type reverser with separate flow exhaust nozzle
 =3, Simple target type reverser with mixed flow exhaust nozzle
 =4, Separate flow engine exhaust system without thrust reverser
 =5, Short duct engine without thrust reverser

IPFLAG.description:
Print controller for Cost Module
 = 0, Only print major cost elements
 = 1, Print details

IRAD.description:
Indicator to include research and development
 =0, Ignore R & D costs
 = 1, Include R & D costs distributed over entire program

IRANGE.description:
Range indicator
 = 0, Short range
 = 1, Medium range
 = 2, Long range

ISPOOL.description:
Auxiliary power unit complexity indicator
 = 0, Single spool, fixed vane APU
 = 1, Double spool, variable vane APU

ITRAN.description:
Cargo/baggage transfer operation indicator
 = 0, Through(no transfer) operation
 = 1, Transfer operation

IWIND.description:
Windshield type indicator
 = 0, Flat windshield
 = 1, Curved windshield

LIFE.description: Number of years for Life Cycle Cost calculation

NCHAN.description: Number of autopilot channels (1, 2, or 3; 1 most common)

NGEN.description: Number of inflight operated generators (3 or 4)

PCTFC.description: Percent of seats for first class

PLMQT.description: Planned MQT (150-hour Model Qualification Test or FAA certification), year

RESID.description: Residual value at end of lifetime, percent

ROI.description: Return on investment, percent (Triggers calculation of required fare)

TAXRAT.description: Corporate tax rate for ROI calculations

TEMP.description: Maximum turbine inlet temperature, degrees F

BLOCKF.description:
Block fuel, lb or fraction of aircraft fuel capacity
(Default = 0.90 * (FULWMX + FULFMX), Namelist $WTIN)

FMCOMP.description: Composite materials(applied to the wing, tails, fuselage, and nacelles manufacturing

allOf.description:
Engine Deck Control, Scaling and Usage Data
(Required if IANAL = 3 or 4 or INENG = 1 in Namelist $OPTION)

NGPRT.description:
=0, No printout of engine input data
=1, Print engine data tables (Default)
=2, Also print sorted engine input data

IGENEN.description:
Switch indicating source of Engine Deck
 = 1, Engine Deck to be generated, requires Namelist
$ENGINE and external files TFILE and IFILE (See     
 Namelist $ENGINE)
 = 0, Engine Deck follows Namelist $ENGDIN (Default)
 =-1, Engine Deck is on external file EIFILE        
(thrust/fuel flow)
 =-2, Engine Deck is on external file EIFILE
(horsepower/rpm/fuel flow)  Requires Namelist
$ENGINE to calculate propeller performance

EIFILE.description:
Name of Engine Deck external file(s) (Default =
'ENGDEK') Used only if IGENEN = -1

EXTFAC.description:
Slope factor for extrapolating engine fuel flows for
thrust levels above the maximum for that Mach number
and altitude (Default = 1.)

FFFSUB.description:
Fuel flow factor for all subsonic engine points
(Default = 1.)

FFFSUP.description:
Fuel flow factor for all supersonic engine points
(Default = 1.)

IDLE.description:
> 0, Flight idle data will be internally generated
with zero thrust and an extrapolated fuel flow.
 The fuel flow must be at least FIDMIN times the
fuel flow at power setting number IDLE and no
more than FIDMAX times the fuel flow at power
setting number IDLE.  If NONEG (below) = 0 and
negative thrusts exist, an idle power setting
is not generated.
 =0, The lowest input power setting is assumed
to be flight idle (Default, but not recommended.
 Results will be more consistent with IDLE > 0)

NONEG.description:
=1, Points in the Engine Deck with negative thrust
            are ignored.
=0, All input or generated points are used (Default)

FIDMIN.description:
Minimum fraction of the fuel flow at power setting
number IDLE for generated flight idle fuel flows
(Default = 0.08)

FIDMAX.description:
Maximum fraction of the fuel flow at power setting
number IDLE for generated flight idle fuel flows
(Default = 1.00)

IXTRAP.description:
=1, Prevents improvement in SFC and NOx rate for
            engine data extrapolated beyond altitudes
            provided in input data (Default)
=0, Linear extrapolation of both thrust and fuel
            flow data may result in radically improved SFC's

IFILL.description:
=0, No part power data will be generated
            > 0, Part power cruise data will be filled in for
Mach-altitude points for which IFILL (or fewer)
            thrust levels have been input (Default = 2)
For NPCODE > 1, data will be filled in for each
            specified power code that is not input for each
Mach-altitude point.

MAXCR.description: Maximum power setting used for cruise (Default = 2)

NOX.description:
=0, NOx emissions data will not be used (Default)
=1, NOx emissions indices are included in the Engine
Deck or will be generated for IGENEN > 0
=2, Engine Deck contains NOx emissions in lb/hr and
            will be converted to indices
=3, Engine Deck contains another engine parameter in
            the place of the NOx Emissions Index.  Used for
            printout and plotting only.
If IGENEN=-2, NOx emissions data are replaced with
            engine shaft speed, rpm.

NPCODE.description:
Number of power codes to be used in thrust and fuel
flow tables if other than ALL.  NPCODE AND PCODE are
used to specify a subset of the input power codes.
 If < 2, power codes (PC) in the Engine Deck will be
ignored and all input data will be used.
(Default = 0, Maximum = 16)

PCODE.description:
Power codes to be used in sorting the Engine Deck.
 NPCODE values are required corresponding to thrust
levels in descending order, i.e., climb, maximum
continuous, part power cruise settings, and flight
idle.  Actual values are arbitrary (they are just
used as labels), but only points in the Engine Deck
with corresponding values for PCODE will be used.
(Used if NPCODE > 1)

BOOST.description:
> 0., Scale factor for boost engine to be added to
baseline engine for takeoff and climb.  Climb
thrust of the boost engine in the Engine Deck
must be artificially increased by 100,000.
 =0., No boost engine (Default)

IGEO.description:
=0, Engine deck altitudes are geometric (Default)
=1, Engine deck altitudes are geopotential and
            will be converted to geometric altitudes

EMACH.description:
(I,1) Array of Mach numbers in descending order at which    
engine data are to be generated (Default computed
internally, Maximum = 20, Minimum = 2, Do not zero
fill)

ALT.description:
(J,I,1) Arrays of altitudes in descending order, one set for
each Mach number, at which engine data are to be
generated (Default computed internally, Maximum = 20        
per Mach number, Minimum = 2 per Mach number, Do not        
zero fill).  Altitudes and numbers of altitudes do
not have to be consistent between Mach numbers.

INSDRG.description:
Nozzle installation drag scaling switch
 =0, No nozzle installation drag scaling (Default)
 =1, Scale the nozzle installation drag for changes
in A10
 =2, Calculate installation drag based on A10
 =3, Calculate installation drag for Cd = 0 at
 < A9 = A9REF

CDFILE.description:
Name of the file containing the table of drag
coefficients (Default = 'ENDRAG') where D/(q*A)
is a function of Mach number, nozzle boattail
angle and A9/A10 (used only if INSDRG is not
zero).

NAB.description:
Table number in CDFILE to be used for afterbody drag
(Default = 6969, but I don't know why)

NABREF.description:
Table number in CDFILE to be used for reference
afterbody drag (Default = 6969)

A10.description: Maximum nozzle area, sq. in. (Required if INSDRG > 0)

A10REF.description:
Reference maximum nozzle area, sq. in.
(Required if INSDRG > 0)

A9REF.description:
Reference nozzle exit area, sq. in.
(Required if INSDRG = 3)

XNREF.description: Reference nozzle length, in. (Required if INSDRG > 0)

RCRV.description:
Nozzle radius of curvature parameter (Triggers
special nozzle drag option.  Default = not used)

allOf.description:
Data for Engine Deck Generation Using the Internal Cycle Analysis Module 
(Required if IGENEN = 1 or -2 in Namelist $ENGDIN.Note - Some 
variables in this Namelist are logical, others are not.)

IENG.description:
Engine cycle definition input file indicator
 = 0, User defined engine cycle (See IFILE below)     
 = 1, Turbojet (IFILE = 'TURJET', Default)
 = 2, Separate flow turbofan, 2 compressor components 
(IFILE = 'TFNSEP')
 = 3, Mixed flow turbofan, 2 compressor components    
(IFILE = 'TFNMIX')
 = 4, Turboprop (IFILE = 'TURPRP')
 = 5, Turbine bypass (IFILE = 'TBYPAS')
 = 6, Separate flow turbofan, 3 compressor components 
(IFILE = 'TFNSP3')
 = 7, Mixed flow turbofan, 3 compressor components    
(IFILE = 'TFNMX3')
 = 8, 3 Spool separate flow turbofan, 3 compressor    
components (IFILE = 'TFN3SH')
 = 9, 2 Spool turbojet (IFILE = 'TURJT2')

IFILE.description:
Name of cycle definition input file.  Used only if
IENG = 0, but there must be an external file with the
correct name available (See IENG above, no default).       
 To generate your own engine cycle file, see the cycle
definition manual (Cycle.man) or Reference 4.

TFILE.description:
Name of the file containing component map tables
(Default = 'ENGTAB').  This is a required file if the      
engine deck is to be generated.

IPRINT.description:
Engine cycle analysis printout control.  Printout is       
on file OFILE (See below).
 =  0, Important warning messages only
 =  1, Normal output (Default, 200 - 1000 lines)
 =  2, Plus component and station data at each full
throttle point (2000 - 3500 lines)
 =  3, Plus component and station data at each part
power point and engine component tabular data
(2500 - 25000 lines, depending on ITHROT below)
 =  4, Plus convergence history (5000 - 35000 lines)

OFILE.description:
Name of engine cycle analysis printout file
(Default = 'ENGOUT').
 If OFILE = 'OUTPUT', printout will be put on the
standard output file (Unit 6).  If IPRINT = 0 (See
above), OFILE is set to 'OUTPUT' automatically.

GENDEK.description:
If .TRUE., engine data will be saved on the file
designated by EOFILE (below) as an Engine Deck for
future use (Default = .FALSE.)

EOFILE.description:
Name of output Engine Deck for GENDEK = .TRUE.
(Default = 'ENGDEK', See EIFILE in Namelist $ENGDIN)

ITHROT.description:
Controls frequency of part power data generation
 = 0, Computed at each Mach-altitude combination
 = 1, Computed only at the maximum altitude for each
 Mach number (Default)
 = 2, Computed only once, at the maximum altitude for
the maximum Mach number
 Values of 1 or 2 will save over half of the engine
generation cpu time with little impact on results,
but IFILL must be > 0 in Namelist $ENGDIN.

NPAB.description:
Maximum number of afterburning throttle settings for
each Mach-altitude combination (Default = 0)

NPDRY.description:
Maximum number of dry (non-afterburning) throttle
settings ( Default = 15, NPAB + NPDRY .LE. 30 )

XIDLE.description:
Fraction of maximum dry thrust used as a cutoff for
part power throttle settings (Default = .05)

NPRINT.description:
Noise data print control.
 = -1, print compressor component operating line on
normal output file if IPRINT > 0.
 =  0, no printout (default)
 =  1, print noise data file to file named ANOPP
 =  2, print noise data file to file named FOOTPR

IVAT.description:
Flag for variable exit area low pressure turbine.
 Used only for estimating LPT exit area when NPRINT=1
 =  0, fixed area (default)
 =  1, variable area

JET.description:
FOOTPR input data generation control.
 = -1, No noise data will be generated (Default)
 =  0, No jet noise
 =  1, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using the
original Stone/Clark model
 =  2, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using the
improved "Kresja" model
 =  3, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using
 Stone's "ALLJET" model which includes inverted
velocity profile jets
 =  4, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using
 Stone's "JET181" model
 =  5, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using the
 GE M*S jet noise model
 =  6, Calculate jet noise using methods developed by
the SAE A-21 jet noise subcommittee - based on
an ANOPP module

FTMACH.description:
Mach number to calculate FOOTPR input data.
(Default = 0.)

FTALT.description:
Altitude to calculate FOOTPR input data.
(Default = 0. ft.)

DESFN.description:
Engine design point net dry thrust, lb
(Default = THRUST, Namelist $CONFIN)
 Do not use the default for afterburning engines since
 THRUST is the maximum wet thrust rating.  The maximum
wet (afterburning) thrust for the generated engine is
transferred back to THRSO for scaling with THRUST.

XMDES.description:
Engine optimization point Mach number
(Default = VCMN, Namelist $CONFIN).  XMDES and XADES
are used for propulsion only analyses (IANAL = 4)
and do not apply when running program enggen.

XADES.description:
Engine optimization point altitude, ft (Default = CH,
 Namelist $CONFIN).  If XADES < 0., it is interpreted
as the negative of the design point dynamic pressure
(psf), and the altitude is back-calculated with a
minimum of 0.

BPRDES.description:
Bypass ratio (Turbofans only, Default is computed
based on OPRDES, FPRDES, TTRDES, XMDES and ALDES).
 If BPRDES < -1, then the bypass ratio is computed
such that the ratio of the fan to core jet velocities
equals the absolute value of BPRDES.  For turbine
bypass engines, BPRDES must be input and is defined
as the fraction of compressor exit airflow that is
bypassed around the main burner and the turbine.  If
both EBPR and BPRDES are zero, the optimum bypass
ratio is computed at the design Mach number and
altitude (XMDES, XADES).

TETDES.description:
Engine design point turbine entry temperature, deg R
(Default = 2500.)

TTRDES.description:
Engine throttle ratio defined as the ratio of the
maximum allowable turbine inlet temperature divided
by the design point turbine inlet temperature.  If
 TTRDES is greater than TETDES, it is assumed to be
the maximum allowable turbine inlet temperature.
(Default = 1.0)

HPCPR.description:
Pressure ratio of the high pressure (third)
compressor.  (Only used if there are three compressor
components, Default = 5.)

ABURN.description: True if there is an afterburner (Default = .FALSE.)

DBURN.description:
True if there is a duct burner (Separate flow
turbofans only, Default = .FALSE.)  ABURN and DBURN
cannot both be true.

TABMAX.description:
Maximum afterburner/duct burner temperature, deg R
(Default = 3500.)

VEN.description:
True if the exhaust nozzle has a variable flow area
(Default = .FALSE.)  The nozzle flow area is
automatically allowed to vary for cases when the
afterburner or duct burner is on.

COSTBL.description:
Customer high pressure compressor bleed, lb/sec
(Default = 1.)

FANBL.description:
Fan bleed fraction, only used for bypass engines
(Default = 0.)

HPEXT.description:
Customer power extraction, hp
(Default = 200. or 5. if IENG > 100)

WCOOL.description:
Turbine cooling flow as a fraction of high pressure
compressor mass flow. The cooling flow defaults to
the value in the engine cycle definition file. If
 WCOOL is input greater than or equal to zero
the default will be overridden.
 If WCOOL > 1., the turbine cooling flow fraction
required to bring the turbine inlet temperature
down to WCOOL will be computed.

DTCE.description:
Deviation from standard day temperature in degrees C
 The deviation, as used in the cycle analysis module,
is DTCE at sea level and varies to zero at ALC (see
below). The design point is at standard temperature.

ALC.description:
The altitude at which DTCE (see above) becomes zero.
(Default = 10000. ft.)

YEAR.description:
Technology availability date used to estimate
compressor polytropic efficiency (Default = 1985.)

BOAT.description:
True to include boattail drag (Default = .FALSE.)
 Boattail drag uses a simple empirical method
based on area ratio (Ae/A10) and Mach number
unless tables are included in TFILE and the engine
cycle definition file (IFILE) has the correct
table reference numbers (see CDAT3 in cycle.man).
 A10 is either input (see AJMAX) or calculated
if nacelle weight and geometry calculations are
performed.

AJMAX.description:
Nozzle reference area for boattail drag, sq ft.
 Used only if BOAT = .TRUE.  Default is the largest of
1) 1.1 times the inlet capture area
2) Nozzle exit area at the inlet design point
3) Estimated engine frontal area
4) Estimated nozzle entrance area
or
 If nacelle weight and geometry calculations are
performed (see NGINWT below) AJMAX is set to the
nacelle cross-sectional area at the customer connect.
or
 If AJMAX is less than zero, the cruise design point
nozzle exit area multiplied by the absolute value
of AJMAX is used as the reference.

SPILL.description:
True to include spillage and lip drag in engine
performance data (Default = .FALSE.)

BLMAX.description:
Inlet bleed flow fraction of total flow at the inlet
design point (Default = .016 * AMINDS**1.5)

ETAPRP.description:
Maximum propeller efficiency (Default = 0.840). The
actual propeller efficiency is based on an internal
schedule of efficiency versus Mach number with the
maximum efficiency (ETAPRP) occurring at a Mach
number of 0.80.  To use the Hamilton Standard Method
set ETAPRP=1 and input the propeller characteristics
as defined under "IC Engine or Propeller
 Performance".  To use table look up for propeller
performance, set ETAPRP to the table number
(see cycle.man).

SHPOWA.description:
Design point shaft horsepower divided by the design
point core airflow, HP/(lb/sec) (Default = 60).

CDTMAX.description:
Maximum allowable compressor discharge temperature,
deg R (Default = 99999.).

CDPMAX.description:
Maximum allowable compressor discharge pressure,
psi (Default = 99999.).

VJMAX.description:
(IENG < 100) Maximum allowable jet velocity, ft/sec
(IENG > 100) Propeller tip speed, ft/sec
(Default = 99999.)

ARMAX.description:
Maximum allowable ratio of the bypass area to the
core area of a mixed flow turbofan (Default = 99999.)

LIMCD.description:
Switch to use the compressor discharge temperature
and pressure limits only for optimization.
 = 0, limits at the cruise design Mach number and
altitude used only for optimization
 = 1, limits enforced at all points in the flight
envelope (Default)
 = 2, limits the maximum compressor discharge
temperature, wherever it may be in the flight
envelope (use only for optimization).

optimization.description:
with engine cycle design variables.
 The following apply if IENG > 100.
 = 0, none (Default)
 = 1, calculate total propulsion system weight
 = 2, propeller weight only
 = 3, propeller, cowl, and mounts
 = 4, propeller, cowl, mounts, and exhaust
 = 5, propeller, cowl, mounts, exhaust, and alternator

IWTPRT.description:
Printout control for engine weight calculations.
 Printout is on file OFILE.
 = 0, No output.
 = 1, Print component weights and dimensions (Default)
 = 2, Print component design details.
 = 3, Plus initial and final optimization data.
 = 4, Print component details at each iteration.

IWTPLT.description:
PostScript plot control for engine (and nacelle)
schematics on file PLTFIL (See below, default = 0).
 If the negative value is input, only the final design
will be plotted.
 = 0, No plot (Default).
 = 1, One correct aspect ratio plot of engine and
nacelle (one page per design).
 = 2, One correct apsect ratio plot of engine only
and one of engine and nacelle (two pages per
design).
 = 3, 1 with full page plot (two pages per design).
 = 4, 2 with full page plot (four pages per design).

PLTFIL.description: Name of the PostScript plot file (Default = 'ENGPLT')

GRATIO.description:
Ratio of the RPM of the low pressure compressor to
the rpm of the connected fan (Default = 1).

UTIP1.description:
Tip speed of the first compressor (or fan) in the
flow.  Default is based on YEAR, engine type, and
other design considerations.

RH2T1.description:
Hub to tip radius ratio of the first compressor (or
fan) in the flow.  Default is based on YEAR, engine
type, and other design considerations.

IGVW.description:
Flag for compressor inlet guide vanes
 = 0, None (default)
 = 1, Fixed
 = 2, Variable
 Use negative 1 or 2 for no IGV on the fan.

TRBRPM.description:
The rotational speed of any free turbine (rev/min).
 TRBAN2 is used to set the free turbine rotational
speed if TRBRPM is not input. TRBRPM overrides TRBAN2.
(Default = not used)

TRBAN2.description:
Maximum allowable AN**2 for turbine components.  The
input value is the actual maximum divided by 10**10.
 AN**2 is the flow area in square inches multiplied by
the rotational speed squared and has units of
in**2*RPM**2.  The default is based on year.

TRBSTR.description:
Turbine usable stress lower limit, psi.  Normally when
component weights are predicted, the usable stress is
a function of operating conditions.  For turbine
components, this can be unusually low because cooling
effects are not accounted for.  (Default = 15000.)

CMPAN2.description:
Maximum allowable AN**2 for compressor components.
 The input value is the actual maximum divided by
10**10.  AN**2 is the flow area in square inches
multiplied by the rotational speed squared and has
units of in**2*RPM**2.  The default is based on year.

CMPSTR.description:
Requested compressor usable stress, psi.  This forces
a change in compressor material when the current
(lower temperature) material starts to run out of
strength as temperature increases.
(Default = 25000.)

VJPNLT.description:
Weight penalty factor for a suppressor to reduce the
core jet velocity to 1500 ft/sec (Default = 0.)

WTEBU.description:
Fraction for weight of engine build up unit (pylon,
mounting hardware, etc) (Default = 0.2)

WTCON.description:
Fraction for weight of engine controls
(Default = 0.05)

ALCRIT.description:
Critical turbocharger altitude, ft.  The altitude to
which turbocharged IC engines are able to maintain
 DESHP (Default = 0., no turbocharger)

SFCMAX.description:
Brake specific fuel consumption at maximum power,
lb/hr/hp (Default = 0.52)

SFCMIN.description:
Minimum brake specific fuel consumption or SFC,
lb/hr/hp (Default = 0.4164)

PWRMIN.description:
Fraction of maximum power where SFCMIN occurs
 If NRPM > 0 and PWRMIN > 1 then PWRMIN is the
rotational speed where SFCMIN occurs (recommend
 PWRMIN > 1 if SFCMIN is less than about 0.4;
 Default = 0.65)

NTYP.description:
Propeller type indicator
 = 1, fixed pitch
 = 2, variable pitch (Default)
 = 3, variable pitch, full feathering
 = 4, variable pitch, full feathering, deicing
 = 5, variable pitch, full feathering, deicing,
w/reverse
 = 6, ducted fan

BLANG.description: Blade angle for fixed pitch propeller, deg

GBLOSS.description:
Gearbox losses, fraction (default = 0.02)
 If PRPSPD = ENGSPD, there are no losses.

PLDES.description: Design point power loading, PL = SHP/D^2

TSDES.description: Design point power tip speed, ft/s

NRPM.description: Number of points in power curve (Maximum is 15).

ARPWR.description: Engine shaft power at ARRPM(I), hp

LFUUN.description:
Fuel input type indicator
 = 0, Fuel flows are computed from SFCMAX, SFCMIN and
 PWRMIN (Default)
 = 1, Brake specific fuel consumption values are input
in ARFUL (lb/hr/hp)
 = 2, Actual fuel flows are input in ARFUL (lb/hr)
 = 3, Actual fuel flows are input in ARFUL (gal/hr)

ARFUL.description:
Engine fuel requirements at ARRPM(I), (Required only
if LFUUN is not equal to zero)

FGBOX.description: Scale factor on gear box weight (Default = 1.)

EngineDeck.description:
Tabular Engine Performance Data 
(Required in this position if IGENEN = 0,
and from an external file if IGENEN = -1)

IsEmpty.description: Determines whether there are no entries

Entries.description:
Entries for each Mach-altitude-thrust combination
 * Mach number
 * Altitude, ft
 * Power code(used only if NPCODE > 1)
 * Gross thrust, lb Shaft power, hp (if IGENEN = -2)
 * Ram drag, lb, Power extraction, hp (if IGENEN = -2)
 * Fuel flow, lb/hr,
 * NOx Emissions Index, grams/kilogram fuel
(or NOx Emissions, lb/hr or other engine
parameter selected by user - See NOX,
Namelist $ENGDIN, used only if NOX > 0)
 * Engine shaft speed, rpm(if IGENEN = -2)
Nozzle exit area, sq. in. (Required only if
INSDRG = 1 in Namelist $ENGDIN)

allOf.description:
Data for Computation of Nacelle Weights
(Required only if NGINWT in Namelist $ENGINE is not equal to 0)

X1R.description:
X1 / R (Default = 2.06). If IVAR (see below) = -1,        
 X1R is the cowl length divided by the inlet
capture radius.

ANGLE.description:
Average angle of the subsonic diffuser portion
of the inlet between the throat and the engine
face (Default = 10 degrees).

MIXED.description:
Inlet compression type indicator.
 = -1, Inlet geometry is based solely on the geometry
variables described above (Default).
 =  0, Inlet geometry is based in the internal       
geometry data base for external compression
inlets and the given inlet design Mach number.
 =  1, Inlet geometry is based in the internal
geometry data base for mixed compression inlets
and the given inlet design Mach number.

RADD.description:
Distance from the engine compressor tip to the
exterior of the nacelle (Default = 3. in).  If
 RADD < 1. the added radial distance is RADD
times the compressor tip radius.

XNLD2.description: Fan nozzle length / height (Default is computed).

INAC.description:
Nacelle type indicator
 = 0, None (Default)
 = 1, Axisymmetric
 = 2, Two-dimensional (use -2 if two or more engines
are to be podded together)
 = 3, Two-dimensional inlet / axisymmetric nozzle
(use -3 if two or more engines are to be podded
together)
 = 4, Two-dimensional bifurcated inlet / two-
dimensional nozzle (use -4 if two or more engines
are to be podded together)
 = 5, Two-dimensional bifurcated inlet / axisymmetric
nozzle (use -5 if two or more engines are to be
podded together)

IVAR.description:
Variable geometry switch used to estimate weight
factor WTCB1 described below
 =-1, Fixed geometry inlet (no centerbody)
(See X1R above.)
 = 0, Fixed geometry inlet (with centerbody)
 = 1, Translating centerbody (Default)
 = 2, Collapsing centerbody
 = 3, Translating and collapsing centerbody

NVAR.description:
Variable geometry switch used to estimate weight
factor WTNOZ described below
 = 0, Fixed geometry nozzle (Default)
 = 1, Variable area throat
 = 2, Variable area exit
 = 3, Variable area throat and exit
 = 4, Fixed geometry plug core nozzle and fixed
geometry fan nozzle (typical subsonic transport
installation)

WTCB2.description:
Weighting factor for the inlet centerbody from the
throat to the engine face

WTINT.description:
Weighting factor for the internal cowl up to the
engine face

WTEXT.description: Weighting factor for the external nacelle

H2W.description:
Inlet height to width ratio for 2-D inlets
(Default = 1.0)

allOf.description:
Performance Controls and Factors and Mission Segment Definition 
(Required if IANAL = 3 in Namelist $OPTION)

INDR.description:
= 0, DESRNG (Namelist $CONFIN) is in n.mi. (Default)
 = 1, Endurance mission - DESRNG is in minutes

FACT.description:
Factor to increase or decrease fuel flows
(Default = 1.)  Cumulative with FFFSUB and FFFSUP in
 Namelist $ENGDIN.

FCDO.description:
Factor to increase or decrease lift-independent drag
coefficients (Default = 1.)

FCDI.description:
Factor to increase or decrease lift-dependent drag
coefficients (Default = 1.)

FCDSUB.description:
Factor to increase or decrease all subsonic drag
coefficients (Default = 1.)  Cumulative with FCDO
and FCDI.

FCDSUP.description:
Factor to increase or decrease all supersonic drag
coefficients (Default = 1.)  Cumulative with FCDO
and FCDI.

ISKAL.description:
Special option used to turn off engine scaling
 = 1, If engine is to be scaled using THRUST/THRSO
(Default)
 = 0, If engine scaling is to be ignored

OWFACT.description:
Factor for increasing or decreasing OWE
(Default = 1.)

IFLAG.description:
= 0, Prints mission summary data only (Default)
 = 1, Plus details of cruise optimization
 = 2, Plus climb and descent profiles
(More complete data is available with MSUMPT = 1)
 = 3, Plus scaled engine data

MSUMPT.description:
= 1, Detailed mission summary will be calculated and
printed
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

DTC.description:
Deviation from standard day temperature in degrees C
(See also DTCT in Namelist $TOLIN and DTCE in
 Namelist $ENGINE.  These temperature deviations
are independent.)

IRW.description:
= 1, Calculates ramp weight with fixed range
 = 2, Fixed ramp weight, calculates range (Default)

RTOL.description:
Tolerance in range calculation for IRW = 1, n.mi.
(Default = .001)

NHOLD.description:
Special option - Time for segment NHOLD (which must
be a Hold Segment) is adjusted until the specified
range is met for the input ramp weight (Default = 0,
 Normal operation) Note - IRW must be 1

IATA.description:
= 1, Range is adjusted for ATA Traffic Allowance
(Default)
 = 0, Otherwise

TLWIND.description:
Velocity of tail wind, kts (Default = 0.)
(Input negative value for head wind)

NPCON.description:
Number of performance constraints - primarily for
fighters.  Requires a Namelist $PCONIN for each
constraint.  (Default = 0, Maximum = 30)

DWT.description:
Gross weight increment for performance tables, lb
(Default is internally computed)

OFFDR.description: Off design range, n.mi. (up to 10 values)

IDOQ.description:
= 1, Drag increments are in the form of D/q, ft2
 = 0, Drag increments are drag coefficients (Default)

NSOUT.description:
Last segment number in outbound leg
(Default = 0, radius is not calculated)

NSADJ.description:
Cruise segment in outbound leg to be adjusted
for radius calculation (Default = NSOUT)
 Note: Make sure that the NSADJ Cruise segment is
terminated on total rather than segment distance in
the Mission Definition Data.

MIRROR.description:
Cruise segment in inbound leg to be set equal to
segment NSADJ (Default = 0, only total leg lengths
are forced to be equal).  This option would be used
for a high-low-low-high mission where the dash in and
dash out are unknown but must be equal to each other.
 NSADJ would be the dash in segment number, and MIRROR
would be the dash out segment number.

STMA.description:
Mach number schedule, up to 20 (I) Mach numbers
for up to 10 (J) conditions

CDST.description:
Corresponding drag coefficients or D/q's
(See IDOQ above)

ISTCL.description:
Store drag condition applied to climb schedule K
 = 0, No store drag for climb schedule K

ISTCR.description:
Store drag condition applied to cruise schedule K
 = 0, No store drag for cruise schedule K

ISTDE.description:
Store drag condition applied to descent schedule
 = 0, No store drag for descent schedule

MYWTS.description:
Weight input switch, overrides value input in
 Namelist $WTIN.  For the XFLOPS Graphical Interface
it must be mixed case as shown.
 = 0, Weights will be computed
 = 1, The following four parameters will be used
in mission analysis

RAMPWT.description:
Gross weight before taxi out, lb
(Default = DOWE + PAYLOD + FUEMAX)

FUEMAX.description:
Total usable fuel weight, lb
 FUEMAX = RAMPWT - DOWE - PAYLOD
 Required only if RAMPWT is not input

APPFFF.description:
Approach fuel flow factor applied to sea level static
idle fuel flow (Default = 2.)

NDKTO.description:
Engine deck number used for takeoff and taxi for
 ITTFF > 0 (Default = 1)

ITTFF.description:
> 0, Engine deck power setting for takeoff.
(Usually = 1 if specified)
 Taxi fuel flow is sea level static idle.
 = 0, Use the following two variables (Default)

XNZ.description: Maximum turn load factor at the Ith Mach number, g's

XCL.description: Maximum turn lift coefficient at the Ith Mach number

XMACH.description: Mach number array corresponding to both XNZ and XCL

NCLIMB.description:
Number of climb schedules to be defined
(Default = 1, Maximum = 10, Include reserve climb)

FWF.description:
Climb profile optimization function control parameter
 Recommended aircraft in parentheses.
(Default = -.001)
 =  1., minimum fuel-to-distance profile (Subsonic
transports, do NOT use for supersonic
transports)
 =  0., minimum time-to-distance profile
(Interceptors only)
1. > FWF > 0., combination of the above
 = -.001, minimum time-to-climb profile (Fighters)
 = -1., minimum fuel-to-climb profile (Supersonic
transports, Subsonic transports)
-1. < FWF < -.001, combination of the above

NCRCL.description:
Number of the cruise schedule to be used in fuel- or
time-to-distance profile climb optimization
comparisons (Default = 1)

CLDCD.description:
Drag coefficient increment applied to the Ith climb
schedule.  If coefficient varies with Mach number,
see ISTCL above.

IPPCL.description:
Number of power settings to be considered for climb.
 Program will select the most efficient.  Should be
used only with afterburning engines for minimum fuel
climb profiles.  (Default = 1, full thrust only)

MAXCL.description: Maximum power setting used for climb (Default = 1)

NDKCL.description: Engine deck number used for climb (Default = 1)

NO.description:
Number of input climb altitudes and speeds
(Maximum = 20)
 = 0, Climb profile will be optimized (Default)

ACTAB.description:
Altitude schedule, ft
(NO(I) values for the Ith climb schedule)

KEASVC.description:
= 1, VCTAB is in knots equivalent airspeed (keas)
 = 0, VCTAB is true airspeed or Mach number (Default)

VCTAB.description:
Climb speed schedule, kts, keas or Mach number
(NO(I) values for the Ith climb schedule)

IFAACL.description:
= 0, Climb at optimum speed
 = 1, Climb speed limited by the FAA to a maximum of
250 knots calibrated airspeed below 10,000 ft
(Default)
 = 2, Climb to 250 kcas at 1500 ft and then to SPDLIM
(See below) at 10,000 ft

IFAADE.description:
= 0, Descend at optimum speed
(Default if IFAACL = 0)
 = 1, Descent speed limited by the FAA to a maximum of
250 knots calibrated airspeed below 10,000 ft
(Default if IFAACL > 0)

NODIVE.description:
= 0, Program will select the optimum altitude
for each energy level.  (Default)
 = 1, Minimum rate of climb limit (see DIVLIM below)
will be enforced

DIVLIM.description:
Minimum allowable rate of climb or descent, ft/min
(Default = 0.)  Enforced only if NODIVE = 1, may be
negative to allow a shallow dive during climb.

QLIM.description:
Constant dynamic pressure limit, psf.  Applied at all
climb and descent points not covered by the variable
dynamic pressure limit below.  (Default = no limit)

SPDLIM.description:
Maximum speed at 10,000 ft, used only for IFAACL = 2,
kts or Mach number (Default is computed from a) the
variable dynamic pressure limit below, if applicable,
b) QLIM above, if QLIM > 0., or c) a dynamic pressure
of 450 psf, in that order)

NQL.description:
Number of altitudes for q limit schedule
(Default = 0 - QLIM is used, Maximum = 20 )

QLALT.description:
Altitudes in increasing order, ft
(QLIM is used outside the altitude range defined)

NCRUSE.description:
Number of cruise schedules to be defined
(Default = 1, Maximum = 15, Include reserve cruise)

IOC.description:
Cruise option switch
 = 0, optimum altitude and Mach number for
specific range
 = 1, fixed Mach number, optimum altitude for
specific range (Default)
 = 2, fixed Mach number at input maximum
altitude or cruise ceiling
 = 3, fixed altitude, optimum Mach number for
specific range
 = 4, fixed altitude, optimum Mach number for
endurance (minimum fuel flow)
 = 5, fixed altitude, constant lift coefficient
(CRCLMX)
 = 6, fixed Mach number, optimum altitude for
endurance
 = 7, optimum Mach number and altitude for
endurance
 = 8, maximum Mach number at input fixed altitude
 = 9, maximum Mach number at optimum altitude
 =10, fixed Mach number, constant lift coefficient
(CRCLMX)

CRMACH.description:
Maximum or fixed Mach number (or velocity, kts)
(Default = VCMN, Namelist $CONFIN)

CRALT.description:
Maximum or fixed altitude, ft
(Default = CH, Namelist $CONFIN)

FLRCR.description:
Specific range factor for long range cruise
 Mach number - used if IOC = 3
(Default = 1., Typical value = .99)

HPMIN.description:
Minimum cruise altitude, ft (Default = 1000.)
 For fixed Mach number cruise schedules, HPMIN can be
used to enforce a dynamic pressure (Q) limit.

NDKCR.description: Engine deck number used for cruise (Default = 1)

FFUEL.description:
Fuel factor in cruise profile optimization
(Default = 1.)

FNOX.description:
NOx emissions factor in cruise profile optimization
(Default = 0.) Since for supersonic engines the NOx
emissions are on the order of 1 - 3 percent of fuel,
 FNOX should be relatively large (30. - 100.) to get
comparable weighting.

IFEATH.description:
= 1, Engines may be feathered during cruise to
improve performance
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)
 =-1, Engines must be feathered (Engine out condition)

FEATHF.description:
Fraction of engines remaining after feathering
(Default = 0.5)

CDFETH.description: Drag coefficient increase due to feathered engines.

DCWT.description:
Weight increment used to compute cruise tables, lb
(Default = the greater of 1. or DWT/20)

RCIN.description:
Instantaneous rate of climb for ceiling
calculation, ft/min (Default = 100.)

ISTPCR.description:
Step cruise switch
 = 1, The FREE segment is flown in step cruise mode
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

ICLN.description:
Number of the climb schedule to be used for climbs
in between constant altitude step cruise segments
(Default = 1)

STPMIN.description:
Minimum range for last step cruise segment
(Default = 300 n.mi.)
 Note: This doesn't currently work very well.

WTBM.description:
Array of weights, lb (Maximum = 50, Minimum = 2, must
be in ascending order) Since linear interpolation/
extrapolation is used, data should cover the entire
expected weight range. (Default = not used)

ALTBM.description: Corresponding array of maximum altitudes, ft

IVS.description:
Descent option switch
 = 0, no descent time, distance or fuel
 = 1, descent at optimum lift-drag ratio (Default)
 = 2, descent at constant lift coefficient

DEDCD.description: Drag coefficient increment applied to descent

RDLIM.description:
Limiting or constant rate of descent, ft/min
 Must be negative (Default = -99999)

NDKDE.description: Engine deck number used for descent (Default = 1)

NS.description:
Number of input descent altitudes and speeds
(Maximum = 20)

KEASVD.description:
= 1, VDTAB is in knots equivalent airspeed (keas)
 = 0, VDTAB is true airspeed or Mach number (Default)

VDTAB.description:
Descent speed schedule, kts, keas or Mach number
(NS values)

IRS.description:
Reserve fuel calculation switch
 = 1, Reserves at calculated reserve fuel for trip to
alternate airport plus RESRFU and/or RESTRP
 = 2, Reserves at constant values (RESRFU and/or
 RESTRP) only (Default)
 = 3, Special Option - Reserve fuel is what is left
over after primary mission has been flown

RESRFU.description:
> 1., Fixed reserve fuel, lb
 < 1., Reserve fuel as a fraction of total usable fuel
weight

RESTRP.description: Reserve fuel as a fraction of total trip fuel weight

RESRPW.description:
> 1., Fixed reserve alternate energy
 < 1., Reserve alternate energy as a fraction of
 POWMAX

RPWTRP.description:
Reserve alternate energy as a fraction of total trip
alternate energy used

ALTRAN.description:
Range to alternate airport, n.mi.
(Default = 0, no reserve mission)

NCLRES.description:
Climb schedule number used in reserve mission
(Default = 1)

NCRRES.description:
