Cruise schedule number used in reserve mission
(Default = 1)

NCRHOL.description: Cruise schedule number for hold (Default = NCRRES)

IHOPOS.description:
Hold position switch
 = 0, Hold occurs between main mission descent and
missed approach
 = 1, Hold occurs at end of reserve cruise (Default)
 = 2, Hold occurs at end of reserve descent

ICRON.description:
= 0, Climb-cruise-descend to alternate airport
 = 1, Climb-cruise-beam down to alternate airport
 = 2, Cruise only to alternate airport

THOLD.description:
> 1., Reserve holding time, min
 < 1., Fraction of flight time to be used as reserve
holding time.  (Effective only if IRW = 1)
 = 0., This option is ignored (Default)

MissionDefinitionData.description:
Main Mission Flight Sequence Definition
(Required if IANAL = 3 in Namelist $OPTION)

Kind.description:
Segment kind:
STAR (Start mission)
CLIM (Climb)
CRUI (Cruise)
REFU (Refuel)
RELE (Release)
ACCE (Accelerate)
TURN (Sustained turn)
COMB (Combat)
HOLD (Hold)
DESC (Descent)
END (End mission)

StartStartingMach.description: Starting Mach number (Default = CLMMIN for first climb segment)

StartStartingAltitude.description: Starting altitude, ft (Default = CLAMIN for first climb segment)

ClimbStartingMach.description:
Starting Mach number (Default = ending Mach number
for previous segment or START card)

ClimbStartingAltitude.description: Starting altitude, ft Required if starting Mach number is specified)

ClimbRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

CruiseTerminationCriterion.description:
Cruise segment termination criterion
 = 0, cruise terminates on distance (Default)
 = 1, cruise terminates on fuel burned - This would be 
used to terminate cruise when external fuel is
exhausted in order to drop the external tank.

CruiseTotalDistance.description:
Total distance (or fuel burned) at the end of this 
cruise segment, n.mi.Required for all but the 
"free" cruise segment (see notes below)

CruiseDistance.description:
Distance (or fuel burned) for this segment only.
If input, overrides data input in columns 11-20.

CruiseRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

RefuelFuelAdded.description:
Fuel added, lb (If the maximum usable fuel, FUEMAX,
would be exceeded, fuel is just topped off)

RefuelMach.description:
Mach number (Default = ending Mach number for 
previous segment)

RefuelAltitude.description:
Altitude, ft (Default = ending altitude for
previous segment)

RefuelRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

ReleaseMach.description:
Mach number (Default = ending Mach number for
previous segment)

ReleaseAltitude.description:
Altitude, ft Default = ending altitude for
previous segment)

AccelerationEngineDeck.description: Engine deck number for this segment

AccelerationDragCondition.description:
Number of store drag condition to be applied to
this segment

AccelerationStartingMach.description:
Starting Mach number (Default = ending Mach number
for previous segment) If this is input, distance
is not included in mission range.

AccelerationAltitude.description:
Altitude, ft (Default = ending altitude for
previous segment)

AccelerationWeightSpecified.description:
Weight specified for point performance.If this is
input, distance is not included in mission range.

AccelerationRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

TurnEngineDeck.description: Engine deck number for this segment

TurnDragCondition.description:
Number of store drag condition to be applied to
this segment

TurnPowerSetting.description: Power setting for max G turn (Default is specified G turn)

TurnAcceleration.description:
Turn acceleration, G's (Not used if power setting
is specified.If used, must be > 1.0)

TurnStartingMach.description:
Starting Mach number (Default = ending Mach number
for previous segment)

TurnAltitude.description:
Altitude, ft (Default = ending altitude for
previous segment)

TurnDragIncrement.description:
Drag coefficient increment
Weight specified for point performance

TurnRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

CombatEngineDeck.description: Engine deck number for this segment

CombatMach.description:
Mach number (Default = ending Mach number for
previous segment)

CombatAltitude.description:
Altitude, ft (Default = ending altitude for
previous segment)

CombatRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

HoldRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

DescentRechargeRate.description: Recharge rate for non-fuel burning propulsion system

allOf.description: Performance Constraint Definition

CONALT.description:
Altitude at which constraint is to be evaluated, ft  
(Default = value from preceding constraint)

CONMCH.description:
Velocity at which constraint is to be evaluated, kts 
 If less than or equal to 5., assumed to be Mach
number (Default = value from preceding constraint)

CONNZ.description:
Load factor (Nz) at which constraint is to be        
evaluated, G's (Default = value from preceding       
constraint or 1.)

CONPC.description:
Engine power setting parameter
 < 1., Fraction of maximum available thrust
 = 1., Maximum thrust at this Mach number and altitude
 > 1., Power setting for engine deck
(3. would indicate the third highest thrust)
(Default = value from preceding constraint or 1.)

ICSTDG.description:
Number of store drag schedule (see Namelist $MISSIN)
to be applied to this constraint
(Default = value from preceding constraint or 0)

NDKCON.description:
Number of engine deck to be used for this constraint
(Default = value from preceding constraint or 1)

ICONSG.description: Weight at start of mission segment ICONSG is used

CONFM.description: Fuel multiplier or fraction of fuel burned

ICONTP.description:
Type of constraint:
 5       Minimum acceptable climb rate, ft/min
 6       Maximum acceptable Time-to-Climb, min
(CONAUX = Mission segment number, not including START
if positive, cumulative time to end of segment CONAUX
- does not include TAXI and TAKEOFF times -
if negative, time for segment -CONAUX only.)
 7       Maximum acceptable Time-to-Distance, min
(CONAUX = Mission segment number, see above)
 8       Minimum acceptable sustained load factor(Nz), G's
(no loss of energy)
 9       Minimum acceptable instantaneous load factor
(Nz), G's (CONAUX = Maximum lift coefficient, CLmax)
 10       Minimum acceptable turn rate, deg/sec
 11       Maximum acceptable turn radius, ft
 12       Minimum acceptable excess energy(Ps), ft/sec
(Changed from ft/min 6/5/97)
 13       Minimum acceptable climb ceiling, ft
(CONAUX = limiting rate of climb, ft / min)
 16       Maximum acceptable acceleration or deceleration time
from CONMCH to CONAUX, minutes
(CONAUX = ending velocity, knots or Mach number.
If CONAUX = 0., CONLIM = minimum acceptable
acceleration, ft / sec / sec)
 17       Minimum acceptable maximum speed, kts or Mach number
 20       Minimum acceptable energy bleed rate at the maximum
instantaneous load factor, ft/min(usually negative)
(CONAUX = Maximum lift coefficient, CLmax)
 30       Minimum acceptable thrust margin, lb

AerodynamicData.description:
User Supplied Aerodynamic Drag Polar Data
(Input only if MYAERO > 0 in Namelist $AERIN.If MYAERO = 3,
Namelist $RFHIN is input instead of Cards 1 through 4 in that
position to define the lift dependent drag.)

RFHIN.description:
Aerodynamic Data for Parabolic Drag Polars
(Input in place of Cards 1 through 4 if MYAERO = 3. 
All defaults = 0.unless otherwise noted)

NMD.description:
Number of Mach numbers in lift dependent drag polars
(Must be at least 3)

NCD.description:
NCD - Number of CL's in lift dependent drag polars
(Must be at least 3)

CD.description:
Lift dependent drag coefficients - Start a new line for
each Mach number only if IBO = 1 in Namelist $AERIN

NAP.description:
Number of altitudes for lift independent drag
(Must be at least 3)

NMP.description:
Number of Mach numbers for lift independent drag
(Must be at least 5)

CDP.description:
Lift independent drag coefficients - Start a new line for 
each altitude only if IBO = 1 in Namelist $AERIN
 Input only if MYAERO = 1 or 3.

CDWAV.description:
Wave drag coefficients (added to CDP if MYAERO = 1)
 Input only if IWAVE = 1

allOf.description:
Aerodynamic Data for Parabolic Drag Polars
(Input in place of Cards 1 through 4 if MYAERO = 3. 
All defaults = 0.unless otherwise noted)

MMACH.description:
Number of Mach numbers (Default = Minimum = 2,
 Maximum = 30)

TMACH.description: MMACH Mach numbers in increasing order

CDMIN.description: Minimum drag for each of MMACH Mach numbers

CK.description: Drag-due-to-lift factors for each Mach number

CLB.description: Lift coefficients corresponding to each CDMIN(I)

C1SW.description:
Coefficient for wing area term for each Mach number.
 May be a drag coefficient or D/Q depending on the
values of REFAS, REFBS and EXPS.

C1TH.description:
Coefficient for thrust term for each Mach number.
 May be a drag coefficient or D/Q depending on the
values of REFAT, REFBT and EXPT.

allOf.description:
Scaling Data for Lift Independent Drag 
(Input only if MYAERO = 2.  All defaults = 0.unless otherwise noted)

SREF.description:
Wing area on which aerodynamic input is based, ft2
(Default = SW, Namelist $CONFIN) If different from
 SW, aerodynamics will be scaled.

TREF.description:
Engine thrust corresponding to nacelle size used in
generating aerodynamic input data, lb
(Default = THRUST, Namelist $CONFIN) If different
from THRUST, aerodynamic data will be modified.

ELTOT.description:
Total configuration length, ft
(Default = fuselage length)

ELW.description: Total length of exposed wing, ft

VOLW.description: Total volume of exposed wing, ft3

FORM.description: Subsonic form factor for total configuration

EQL.description:
Equivalent friction length for total baseline
configuration, ft.  If EQL is omitted, skin friction
drag is computed from component data

DCDNAC.description:
Delta wave drag coefficients,
nacelles on - nacelles off (NMP values)

allOf.description:
Detailed Takeoff and Landing Data 
(Used only if ITAKOF, ILAND and/or NOPRO = 1 in Namelist $OPTION)

DTCT.description:
Delta temperature from standard day, deg C
(Default = 0., This parameter is independent
from the DTC in Namelist $MISSIN and DTCE in
 Namelist $ENGINE.)

SWREF.description:
Wing area on which takeoff and landing drag polars
are based, sq ft (Default = SW, Namelist $CONFIN)
 If different from SW, polars will be scaled.

ARRET.description:
Wing aspect ratio on which takeoff and landing drag
polars are based (Default = AR, Namelist $CONFIN)
 If different from AR, polars will be modified.

ALPRUN.description: Angle of attack on ground, deg (Default = 0.)

CDEOUT.description:
Delta drag coefficient due to engine out condition.
 Includes effect of stopped or windmilling engine
and the trim drag associated with compensating for
asymmetric thrust. (Default = 0.)

CLSPOL.description:
Spoiler delta lift coefficient
(Should be negative, Default = 0., no spoiler)

INCGEF.description:
Ground effects switch
 = 1, Include ground effects as appropriate (Default)
 = 0, Do not include ground effects

ARGEF.description: Aspect ratio factor for ground effects (Default=1.)

ITIME.description:
= 1, Detailed takeoff and landing profiles will be
printed
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

INTHRV.description:
= -1, Use takeoff thrust (Default)
 =  0, Input thrust values will be used
 =  1, Input values will be scaled
 >  1, Scaled engine deck for the (INTHRV-1)th
power setting will be used

RVFACT.description:
Fraction of thrust reversed - net  (Default = 0.,
no reverse thrust.  Real values should be negative)

VELRV.description:
Velocities for reverse thrust, ft/sec (10 values,
 Default = 0., 50., ..., 450.)

TIRVRS.description:
Time after touchdown to reverse thrust, sec
(Default = 5.)

REVCUT.description:
Cutoff velocity for thrust reverser, kts
(Default = -1000 = no cutoff)

CLREV.description:
Change in lift coefficient due to thrust reverser
(Default = 0.)

CDREV.description:
Change in drag coefficient due to thrust reverser
(Default = 0.)

DELVTO.description:
Velocity step during ground run, ft/sec
(Default = 4.)

CLTOM.description:
Maximum CL for takeoff (Default, see $AERIN)
 Must be lower case for XFLOPS Graphical Interface

CDMTO.description:
Minimum CD for takeoff, typically, this is the drag
coefficient at zero lift (Default = 0.)

FCDMTO.description: Fraction of CDMTO due to wing (Default = .3)

ALMXTO.description:
Maximum angle of attack during takeoff, deg
(Default = 25.)

OBSTO.description:
Takeoff obstacle height, ft
(Defaults, Transport = 35., Fighter = 50.)

ALPTO.description:
Alpha's for takeoff polar, deg
(at least 2 values required, maximum of 30)

CLTO.description:
CL's for takeoff polar
(one value for each ALPTO)

CDTO.description:
CD's for takeoff polar
(one value for each ALPTO)

INTHTO.description:
= 0, Input thrust values will be used (Default)
 = 1, The input values will be scaled
 > 1, Scaled engine data deck for the (INTHTO-1)th
power setting will be used

VELTO.description:
Velocities for takeoff thrust, ft/sec
(10 values, Default = 0., 50., 100., ..., 450.)

THRTO.description: Thrust values, lb (10 values, Default is INTHTO = 2)

ALPROT.description:
Maximum angle of attack during rotation phase of
takeoff, deg (Default = ALMXTO)

VROTAT.description:
Minimum rotation start speed, knots or fraction
of Vstall (Default = 1.05 Vstall)

THFACT.description:
Thrust multiplier for input or extracted thrust
data (Default = 1.)

FTOCL.description:
Factor for takeoff lift (Default = 1.)
 Also applied to drag polars input in $PROIN

FTOCD.description:
Factor for takeoff drag (Default = 1.)
 Also applied to drag polars input in $PROIN

IGOBS.description:
Gear retraction switch
 = 0, Start landing gear retraction TDELG seconds
after liftoff (Default)
 = 1, Start landing gear retraction TDELG seconds
after obstacle height is reached

TDELG.description:
Time delay after liftoff/obstacle before start of
landing gear retraction, sec (Default = 0.)

TIGEAR.description:
Time required to retract landing gear, sec
 Landing gear drag is reduced using a cosine function.
(Default = 2.)

IBAL.description:
= 1, Balanced field length will be computed using
pre-1998 FAA rules (Default)
 = 2, Balanced field length will be computed using
post-1998 FAA rules
 = 0, Otherwise

ER5KT.description:
Delta velocity for early rotation, kts (Default = 5.)
 See FAR Part 25.107(e)(3)

ITXOUT.description:
Subtract taxi out fuel switch
 = 1, Use (Ramp Weight - Taxi Out Fuel) for
takeoff field length calculations.
 = 0, Use Ramp Weight for takeoff field length
calculations (Default)

PILOTT.description:
Actual pilot reaction time from engine failure to
brake application, sec (Default = 1.).  Spoilers,
brakes, and thrust reversal are assumed to become
effective and engine cutback occurs at PILOTT + 2
seconds after engine failure.

TISPA.description: , TIBRA, and TIRVA are not currently used.

ISPOL.description:
= 0, Spoilers are not used during aborted takeoff
 = 1, Spoilers used during aborted takeoff (Default)

IREV.description:
= 0, No thrust reversal during aborted takeoff
 = 1, Thrust reversal during aborted takeoff only
if all engines are operational (Default)
 = 2, Thrust reversal during aborted takeoff for
both all-engines-operational and one-engine-
out cases

CLLDM.description:
Maximum CL for landing (Default, see $AERIN)
 Must be lower case for XFLOPS Graphical Interface

FCDMLD.description: Fraction of CDMLD due to wing (Default = FCDMTO)

ALMXLD.description:
Maximum angle of attack during landing, deg
(Default = 25.)

ALPLD.description:
Alpha's for landing polar, deg
(at least 2 values required, maximum of 30)

CLLD.description:
CL's for landing polar
(one value for each ALPLD)

CDLD.description:
CD's for landing polar
(one value for each ALPLD)

INTHLD.description:
= 0, Input thrust values will be used (Default)
 = 1, The input values will be scaled
 > 1, Scaled engine data deck will be used

VELLD.description:
Velocities for landing (idle) thrust, ft/sec
(10 values, Default = 0., 50., 100., ..., 450.)

THDRY.description:
Maximum dry thrust at missed appproach for
fighters, lb. (Default = takeoff thrust)

APRHGT.description:
Height above ground for start of approach, ft
(Default = 100.)

DVAPP.description:
Delta approach velocity, kts (Default = 0.)
 Vapp = 1.3 * Vstall + DVAPP

TDSINK.description:
Sink rate at touchdown, ft/sec
(Default = 0., must be positive if input)

NOFLAR.description:
No flare during landing switch
 = 1, There is no flare during approach, sink rate
at touchdown is the approach sink rate with
ground effects.
 = 0, Normal landing with flare (Default)

TISPOL.description:
Time after touchdown to spoiler actuation, sec
(Default = 2.)

TICUT.description:
Time after touchdown to cut back of engines to zero
thrust, sec (Default = 3.)

TIBRAK.description:
Time after touchdown to brake application, sec
(Default = 4.)

MAGRUP.description:
Missed approach landing gear switch
 = 1, Landing gear is up during missed approach
 No landing gear drag (Default for fighters)
 = 0, Landing gear is down during missed approach
 CDGEAR is included in drag
(Default for transports)

allOf.description:
Input Data for Detailed Takeoff and Climb Profile for Nois
Calculations (Used only if NOPRO = 1 in Namelist $OPTION.)

NPOL.description: Number of drag polars to be printed out (Default = 1)

ALPRO.description:
Alpha's for Nth drag polar, deg
 Must be the same number of Alpha's as in ALPTO in
 Namelist $TOLIN

CLPRO.description:
CL's for Nth drag polar
 FTOCL from Namelist $TOLIN is applied

CDPRO.description:
CD's for Nth drag polar
 FTOCD from Namelist $TOLIN is applied

DFLAP.description:
Flap deflection corresponding to Nth drag polar.
 Used only for output (Default = N)

NTIME.description:
= 1, Detailed takeoff and climb profiles for noise
will be printed
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

IPCMAX.description:
Maximum engine power code (Default = 1, This variable
could be used, for example, to limit takeoff and
climb to dry power settings on an afterburning
engine.)

KEAS.description:
= 1, VFIX and VSTOP in Namelist $SEGIN below are in
knots equivalent airspeed (keas)
 = 0, VFIX and VSTOP are true airspeed (Default)

TXF.description:
Fuel used in taxiing out to runway, lb
(Default is computed in mission analysis)

ALPMIN.description:
Minimum angle of attack during climb segment
(Default = 0.)

GAMLIM.description:
Minimum flight path angle during fixed angle of
attack segments, deg. (Default = 0.)

INM.description:
= 1, Generate data files for INM
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

IATR.description:
= 1, Automatic Thrust Restoration indicator switch
on (has no effect on takeoff and climb profile)
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

FLAPID.description:
Six character label for each of the NPOL input drag
polars, for example, 'gearup'

allOf.description:
Data Defining Each Segment in the Detailed Climb Profile
(Required for each noise profile segment if NOPRO = 1 in
Namelist $OPTION)

KEY.description:
Key word specifying reason for end of segment (A4)
 'ROTATE' - Segment ends at start of rotation
 'LIFTOFF' - Segment ends at liftoff
 'OBSTACLE' - Segment ends at obstacle height
 'CHANGE' - Segment ends to change parameters
(Default)
 'CUTBACK' - No distance segment to define required
thrust setting (ENGSCL) for following segment
 'LAST' - Final segment, end of profile calculations

NFLAP.description:
Number of drag polar to be used
(Default = value from previous segment or 1)

IFIX.description:
Constraints for climb segments after 'OBSTACLE'
 = 1, Fixed thrust and constant velocity
 = 2, Fixed thrust and constant flight path angle
 = 3, Fixed thrust and fixed angle of attack
 = 4, Fixed velocity and constant flight path angle
 = 5, Fixed thrust and fixed cabin floor angle (angle
of attack plus flight path angle)
 = 6, Fixed velocity and fixed angle of attack
(Default = value from previous segment or 1)

ENGSCL.description:
Engine setting as a fraction of thrust at IPCMAX
(Default = value from previous segment or 1.)

AFIX.description:
Fixed angle of attack for IFIX = 3 or 6, deg
(Default = final value from previous segment)

GFIX.description:
Fixed flight path angle for IFIX = 2 or 4 or
fixed cabin floor angle for IFIX = 5, deg
(Default = final value from previous segment)

VFIX.description:
Fixed velocity for IFIX = 1, 4 or 6, kts
(Default = final value from previous segment)

DSTOP.description:
Segment termination distance, ft
(Default = value from following segment)

TSTOP.description:
Segment termination time, sec
(Default = value from following segment)

VSTOP.description:
Segment termination velocity, kts (Default = value
from following segment or rotation speed from
detailed takeoff analysis for 'ROTATE' segment)

HMIN.description:
Minimum altitude for segment termination, ft
 Overrides 'STOP' variables above

SPRATE.description:
Thrust reduction rate during segments where the power
setting is reduced, can be used for Programmed Lapse
 Rate (PLR) takeoffs.  (Default = value from previous
segment or 0.1 = 10 percent/second, i.e., a cutback
from 90 to 60 percent thrust would require 3 seconds)
 = 0., Cutback is instantaneous

IPLR.description:
Programmed Lapse Rate switch for this segment
 = 0, Do not use PLR (Default)
 = 1, Thrust factor is reduced to PLR (Namelist
$CONFIN) using SPRATE above
 = 2, Thrust factor is reduced to PLR while landing
gear is retracted (See TDELG and TIGEAR,
 Namelist $TOLIN)

DELT.description:
Time step for post 'OBSTACLE' segments, sec.
(Default = 1.)

GRDAEO.description:
Flight path angle for 'CUTBACK' with all engines
operating, deg (Default = 2.29061 deg or 4 percent)

GRDOEO.description:
Flight path angle for 'CUTBACK' with one engine
out, deg (Default = 0.)

SEGINKEY.description: Key word specifying reason for end of segment (A4)

allOf.description:
Data for Noise Calculations
(Used only if NOISE = 1 in Namelist $AERIN.All defaults = 0.
unless otherwise noted)

IEPN.description:
= 0, Stage III (default)
 = 1, Stage III - Delta dB (see below)
 = 2, Find the X-coordinate where the maximum EPNL
occurs.  NOB, XO and YO must be input.  YO
should be constant.  IEPN=2 is usually used
to get a sideline (YO) noise for GA aircraft.

DEPNT.description: Increment below Stage III for takeoff (see IEPN)

DEPNS.description:
Increment below Stage III for sideline (see IEPN)
 If IEPN=2, DEPNS is the upper limit for sideline noise

DEPNL.description: Increment below Stage III for landing (see IEPN)

ITRADE.description:
= 1, Trade 2 db between sideline and flyover noise
 = 0, Otherwise (default)

IJET.description:
= 0, No jet noise (Default)
 = 1, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using the
original Stone/Clark model
 = 2, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using the
improved "Kresja" model
 = 3, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using
 Stone's "ALLJET" model which includes inverted
velocity profile jets
 = 4, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using
 Stone's "JET181" model
 = 5, Calculate jet mixing/shock cell noise using the
 GE M*S jet noise model
 = 6, Calculate jet noise using methods developed by
the SAE A-21 jet noise subcommittee - based on
an ANOPP module

IFAN.description:
= 0, Do not calculate fan noise (Default)
 = 1, Calculate fan or compressor noise
 = 2, Compute fan noise using simplified Gliebe model

ICORE.description:
= 1, Calculate burner noise
 = 0, No burner noise (Default)

ITURB.description:
= 1, Calculate turbine noise
 = 0, No turbine noise (Default)

IPROP.description:
= 0, No propeller noise (Default)
 = 1, Calculate propeller noise using old SAE Method
 = 2, Calculate propeller noise using Gutin's Method

IFLAP.description:
= 1, Calculate flap noise and jet/flap impingement
noise
 = 0, No flap noise (Default)

IAIRF.description:
= 1, Calculate airframe noise
 = 0, No airframe noise (Default)

IGEAR.description:
= 1, Approximate gear box noise using crude method
 = 0, No gear box noise (Default)

ISUPP.description:
= 1, Apply suppression spectra to each source for
which they are supplied
 = 0, No suppression (Default)

IDOP.description:
= 1, Apply doppler frequency and intensity correction
to total noise
 = 0, No correction (Default)

IGND.description:
= 0, No ground reflection - free field (Default)
 = 1, Perfect ground reflection (+3.01 dB)
 = 2, Calculate ground reflection based on TMX 56033
by T. W. Putnam of DFRC

IATM.description:
= 0, No atmospheric attenuation correction (Default)
 = 1, Correct total noise for atmospheric attenuation
using ARP 866
 = 2, Correct total noise for atmospheric attenuation
using Bass & Shields

IEGA.description:
= 1, Apply extra ground attenuation to total noise
 = 0, No extra ground attenuation (Default)

ISHLD.description:
= 1, Calculate shielding of fan, jet, core, turbine,
and propeller sources
 = 0, No shielding (Default)

DELDB.description:
Number of dB down from the peak noise level to cut
off printing of noise time histories  (Default = 20.)

HENG.description: Height of engine above the ground during taxi, ft

FILBW.description:
Fraction of filter bandwidth with a gain of 1.
(Default = 1.)

ZO.description: Height of all observers above the ground, ft

IFOOT.description:
= 1, Print noise levels of input observers in contour
format to file 'NSPLOT' for subsequent plotting
of the noise footprint
 = 0, No noise footprint plot file (Default)

IGEOM.description:
= 1, Print geometric relations of aircraft/observer
at each time point
 = 0, No print (Default)

THRN.description:
Thrust of baseline engine, lb.  Geometry data and
engine parameter arrays will be scaled accordingly
(Default = THRSO, Namelist $WTIN)

ICORR.description:
= 1, Apply corrections to engine parameters to
correct for ambient conditions
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

TCORXP.description:
Exponent for core temperature correction in engine
parameter arrays  (Default = 1.)

NPARAM.description:
Number of power settings (Default = Minimum = 2,
 Maximum = 20)

AEPP.description: Throttle settings as a fraction of net thrust.

AVC.description:
Core/primary exhaust jet velocity (ideally expanded
velocity; exclude friction and expansion alterations)
ft/sec.  Used for IJET=1,2,3,4,6

AVF.description:
Fan/secondary exhaust jet velocity (ideally expanded
velocity; exclude friction and expansion alterations)
ft/sec.  Used for IJET=1,2,3,4

ATC.description:
Core/primary jet exhaust total temperature, deg R
 Used for IJET=1,2,3,4,6

ATF.description:
Fan/secondary jet exhaust total temperature, deg R
 Used for IJET=1,2,3,4

AAC.description:
Core jet nozzle exhaust area, sq ft.  For IJET=1,2,6,
 AAC represents exit area; for IJET=3,4, AAC
represents throat area.

AAF.description:
Fan jet nozzle exhaust area, sq ft.  For IJET=1 or
 IJET=2, AAF represents exit area; for IJET=3,4, AAF
represents throat area.

ADJ.description:
Core outer diameter, ft; at the equivalent throat
if the nozzle is C-D.   Used only for IJET=3,4

ADJ2.description:
Fan outer diameter, ft; at the equivalent throat if
the nozzle is C-D.  Used only for IJET=3,4

AHJ.description:
Core annulus height, ft; at the equivalent throat if
the nozzle is C-D.  Used only for IJET=3,4

AHJ2.description:
Fan annulus height, ft; at the equivalent throat if
the nozzle is C-D.  Used only for IJET=3,4

AFUEL.description:
Fuel flow, lb/sec.  Used if ICORE, ITURB=1; and
 IJET=1,2 and only if calculating GAMMAC and GASRC.

ATIPM.description:
Fan first-stage relative tip Mach number.  These
are approximated if not input.  Used if IFAN=1

ATIPM2.description:
Fan second-stage relative tip Mach number.  These
are approximated if not input.  Used if IFAN=1

AWAFAN.description: Total engine airflow, lb/sec.  Used if IFAN=1

ADELT.description: Fan temperature rise, deg R.  Used if IFAN=1

AFPR.description:
Fan pressure ratio.  This is not needed if ADELT is
input.  Otherwise, values for ADELT will be
calculated using AFANEF and AFANF2 values.

AFANEF.description:
Fan first-stage efficiency.  These are required if
 AFPR is supplied rather than ADELT.

AFANF2.description:
Fan second-stage efficiency.  These are required if
 AFPR is supplied rather than ADELT.

ARPM.description: Fan or turbine speed, RPM.  Used if IFAN, ITURB=1

AWCORE.description:
Burner and turbine airflow, lb/sec.  Used if ICORE or
 ITURB=1 and IJET=1,2 and only if calculating GAMMAC
and GASRC.

AP3.description: Burner inlet pressure, psf.  Used if ICORE=1

AT3.description: Burner inlet temperature, deg R.  Used if ICORE=1

AT4.description:
Burner exit static temperature, deg R.  These are
approximated from the fuel/air ratio if not input.
 Used if ICORE=1

ATURTS.description:
Turbine last stage rotor relative tip speed, ft/sec.
 These are approximated if not input.
 Used if ITURB=1

ATCTUR.description:
Turbine exit temperature, deg R.  These are assumed
the same as ATC if not supplied.  Used if ITURB=1

AEPWR.description: Some propeller parameter.  Power?  Used if IPROP=1

ATHRST.description: Some propeller parameter.  Thrust?  Used if IPROP=1

AMSP9.description:
Nozzle pressure ratio: entance total to ambient
static.  Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSTT3.description:
Nozzle exit total temperature, deg R.
 Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSA9.description:
Nozzle exit area, sq ft.
 Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSA7.description:
Nozzle ejector chute area ratio.
 Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSAA8.description:
Inner nozzle flow area, sq ft.
 Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSTT4.description:
Inner nozzle exit total temperature, deg R.
 Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSP4.description:
Inner nozzle pressure ratio: entrance total to
ambient static.  Used for M*S code jet predictions,
 IJET=5

AMSTT5.description:
Outer nozzle exit total temperature, deg R.
 Used for M*S code jet predictions, IJET=5

AMSP5.description:
Outer nozzle pressure ratio: entrance total to
ambient static.  Used for M*S code jet predictions,
 IJET=5

INOZ.description:
= 1, Coaxial nozzle
 = 0, Simple circular nozzle (Default)
 Used for IJET=1,2

IPLUG.description:
= 1, Plug nozzle on primary
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)
 Used for IJET=1,2

ISLOT.description:
= 1, Slot nozzle on primary
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)
 Used for IJET=1,2

IAZ.description:
= 1, Azimuthal correction for nozzle geometry is used
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

DBAZ.description:
Noise reduction due to nozzle geometry in dB
at phi = 75 degrees, used only if IAZ = 1

EJDOP.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification on
shock noise only (Default = 1.)  Used for IJET=1,2

ZMDC.description:
Core (primary) jet design Mach number (Default = 1.)
 Used for application of non-ideally expanded shock
noise.  Used for IJET=1,2

GAMMAC.description:
Core (primary) jet exhaust gamma
 Used for IJET=1,2,6  (Default = 1.4)

GASRC.description:
Core exhaust gas constant, ft-lb/lbm-R
 Used for IJET=1,2  (Default = 53.35 ft-lb/lbm-R)

ANNHT.description:
Core nozzle annulus height, ft
 Used for IJET=1,2

ZMDF.description:
Fan (secondary) jet design Mach number (Default = 1.)
 Used for application of non-ideally expanded shock
noise.  Used for IJET=1,2

GAMMAP.description:
Fan (secondary) jet exhaust gamma
 Used for IJET=1,2  (Default = GAMMAF)

GASRF.description:
Fan exhaust gas constant, ft-lb/lbm-R
 Used for IJET=1,2  (Default = 53.35 ft-lb/lbm-R)

ANNHTF.description:
Fan nozzle annulus height, ft
 Used for IJET=1,2

DHC.description:
Core nozzle hydraulic diameter, ft
 Used for IJET=3,4

DHF.description:
Fan nozzle hydraulic diameter, ft
 Used for IJET=3,4

ZL2.description:
Axial distance from the outer exit plane to the exit
plane of the inner nozzle, ft.  Used for IJET=3,4

IFWD.description:
= 1, Forward velocity effects on source
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)
 Used for IJET=1,2,3,4,5

ISHOCK.description:
= 1, Calculate shock noise (Default)
 = 0, Otherwise
 Used for IJET=1,2,3,4,5

ZJSUPP.description: Jet suppression spectrum.  Used for IJET=1,2,3,4,5

IY9.description:
= 1, Convergent, conical nozzle (Default)
 = 2, Single flow, multitube nozzle
 = 3, Single flow, multichute/spoke nozzle
 = 4, Dual flow, convergent conical nozzle
 = 5, Dual flow, multitube suppressors on outer stream
 = 6, Dual flow, multichute/spoke suppressor on outer
stream

N.description:
For IY9=2,5:  Number of tubes
 For IY9=3,6:  Number of elements

RP.description: For IY9=2,3,5,6:  Centerbody plug radius, ft

B9.description:
For IY9=2,5:  Tube centerline cant angle, deg
 For IY9=3,6:  Chute/spoke exit cant angle, deg

Z5.description:
For IY9=2,5:  Number of rows of tubes, counting
center tube (if present) as zero

S1J.description:
For IY9=2,5:  Tube centerline spacing to tube
diameter ratio

A6.description:
For IY9=2,3,5,6:  Ratio of ejector inlet area to
nozzle (total or annulus) area
(input zero for no ejector)

ZL9.description:
For IY9=2,3,5,6:  Ratio of ejector length to
suppressor nozzle equivalent
diameter

A.description: For IY9=2,3,5,6:  Ejector treatment open area ratio

RR.description:
For IY9=2,3,5,6:  Ejector treatment specific
resistance, Rayls (59 values
required)

RX.description:
For IY9=2,3,5,6:  Ejector treatment specific
reactance, Rayls (59 values
required)

R4.description:
For IY9=3,6:  Outer circumferential flow dimension,
in.

R6.description:
For IY9=3,6:  Inner circumferential flow dimension,
in.

SS.description:
For IY9=3,6:  Outer circumferential element
dimension, in.

DN.description: For IY9=5,6:  Nozzle outer diameter, ft

IFD.description:
= 1, Inlet flow distortion during ground run
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

IEXH.description:
= 0, Fan inlet only
 = 1, Fan exhaust only
 = 2, Include both inlet and exhaust (Default)

NFH.description:
Number of harmonics to be considered in
blade-passing tone (Default = 10)

METHTIP.description:
Method for calculation of relative tip Mach number
 = 1, Duplication of ANOPP method (Default)
 = 2, Bruce Clark's method
 = 3, Use input array ATIPM above

ICOMB.description:
= 1, If relative tip Mach number is supersonic,
include combination tones (Default)
 = 0, Otherwise

DECMPT.description: Decrement to apply to combination tones, dB

GAMMAF.description:
Gamma of fan air (Default = 1.4)
 May have been input with jet noise data

EFDOP.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification
on fan noise (Default = 4.)

FANEFF.description:
Constant first stage fan efficiency, < 1.0.
(Default = 0.88) Overridden by AFANEF(I).

NBL2.description: Number of fan blades for second stage (Default = NBL)

NVAN2.description:
Number of stator vanes for second stage
(Default = NVAN)

FAND2.description: Fan diameter for second stage, ft (Default = FANDIA)

TIPMD2.description:
Design relative tip Mach number for second stage
(Default = TIPMD)

RSS2.description:
Rotor-stator spacing in percent for second stage
(Default = RSS)

EFDOP2.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification
on second stage fan noise (Default = EFDOP)

FANEF2.description:
Constant second stage fan efficiency, < 1.0.
(Default = 0.88) Overridden by AFANF2(I).

TRAT.description:
Ratio of second stage temperature rise (DELT2) to
that of first stage.  Either TRAT or PRAT is used to
calculate DELT2.  (Default = use PRAT)

PRAT.description:
Ratio of second stage fan pressure ratio to that of
first stage (Default = 1.)

GAMMA.description:
Specific heat ratio;  required if using AP3 rather
than AT3 (Default = 1.4)

IMOD.description:
= 1, Use modified core level prediction (DTEMD)
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

DTEMD.description:
Design turbine temperature drop, T4des - TCTURdes,
deg R

ECDOP.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification
on core noise (Default = 2.)

CS.description:
Stator chord to rotor spacing ratio, percent
(Usually > 100%)

NBLR.description: Number of last stage rotor blades

ITYPTB.description:
= 1, Turbofans (core ahead of fan exit, e.g., JT8D)
 = 0, Turbojets or fans with coplanar exits (Default)

ETDOP.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification
on turbine noise (Default = 4.)

BLAREA.description: Total blade area for one side of propeller, sq ft

GEARP.description: Ratio of propeller rpm / engine rpm (Default = 1.)

EPDOP.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification
on propeller noise (Default = 1.)

BLATTK.description: Blade angle of attack at 70% span, deg

DHARM.description:
Rate of decrease in harmonic level beyond tenth,
dB/harmonic (Default = .5)

NPH.description: Number of harmonics of BDF desired (Default = 10)

IUOTW.description:
=1, Over-the-wing engine location
 =0, Under-the-wing engine location (Default)
 Engine location (If not input in shielding data)

SWIDE.description:
Degrees of arc where fuselage shielding is greater
than SFUSE/e (e=2.718...) (Default = 60.)

SWING.description:
Maximum wing shielding for over-the-wing engine, dB
(Default = 10.)

SMX.description:
Angle in flyover plane of maximum over-the-wing
shielding, deg.  (Default = 90.)

CFUSE.description:
Characteristic fuselage dimension (such as diameter),
ft (Default = 10.)

CWING.description:
Characteristic wing dimension (such as chord), ft
(Default = 10.)

ILNOZ.description:
= 2, Coaxial nozzle - mixed flow
 = 1, Coaxial nozzle - separate flow
 = 0, Simple circular nozzle (Default)

INSENS.description:
= 1, Configuration with noise levels insensitive to
flap angle
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

BPR.description: Bypass ratio, for mixed flow coaxial nozzle

WINGD.description:
Ratio of wing chord to total nozzle diameter, used
for large BPR designs when WINGD < 3.  (Default = 3.)

ELDOP.description:
Exponent on source motion (Doppler) amplification
on flap noise (Default = 4.)

NF.description:
Number of trailing edge flap slots for IFL = 1
(Default = 2, Maximum = 3)

PFCHD.description:
Average chord for slotted flap, ft or fraction of
wing chord.  Used only if IFL = 1 (Default = .25)

ICLEAN.description:
= 1, Aerodynamically clean aircraft (as a sailplane)
 = 0, Conventional aircraft (Default)

IWING.description:
= 1, Include wing and horiz. and vert. tail noise
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

ISLAT.description:
= 1, Include slatted leading edge noise
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

ILG.description:
= 1, Include nose and main landing gear noise
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

NW.description: Number of wheels per main gear truck (Default = 2)

DW.description: Diameter of main gear tires, ft (Default = 3.)

CG.description: Ratio of main strut length to DW(2) (Default = 3.)

ITONE.description:
= 1, 1/3-octave bands exceeding adjacent bands by
3 dB or more are approximated as tones
 = 0, Otherwise (Default)

NHT.description:
Number of heights to be used to approximate a
distributed source by multiple sources
(Default = 1, Maximum = 10)

DK.description:
Heights of multiple sources from source center, ft
(Default = NHT*0.)

RGND.description:
Real part of complex specific ground impedance,
24 values
(Default = Delaney and Bazley impedance function from
 ANOPP Theoretical Manual for grass-covered ground.)

XGND.description:
Imaginary part of complex specific ground impedance,
24 values
(Default = Delaney and Bazley impedance function from
 ANOPP Theoretical Manual for grass-covered ground.)

allOf.description:
Optimization Control and Constraint Limits
(Required only for IOPT = 3 in Namelist $OPTION.)

DESRNG.description:
Design range, n.mi. (or endurance, min.) See INDR
in Namelist $MISSIN. (No default, Namelist $CONFIN)

VAPPR.description:
Maximum allowable landing approach velocity, kts
(Default = 150., Namelist $AERIN)

FLTO.description:
Maximum allowable takeoff field length, ft
(Default = 12000., Namelist $AERIN)

FLLDG.description:
Maximum allowable landing field length, ft
(Default = FLTO, Namelist $AERIN)

CDTMAX.description:
Maximum allowable compressor discharge temperature,
deg R (Default = 99999., Namelist $ENGINE)

CDPMAX.description:
Maximum allowable compressor discharge pressure, psi
(Default = 99999., Namelist $ENGINE)

VJMAX.description:
Maximum allowable jet velocity, ft/sec
(Default = 99999., Namelist $ENGINE)

STMIN.description:
Minimum allowable specific thrust, lb/lb/sec
(Default = 1., Namelist $ENGINE)

ARMAX.description:
Maximum allowable ratio of the bypass area to the
core area of a mixed flow turbofan.
(Default = 99999., Namelist $ENGINE)

GNOX.description:
Maximum allowable NOx emissions, lb
(Default = not constrained, no other references)

ROCLIM.description:
Minimum allowable potential rate of climb during
climb segments (Default = 100.)

DHDTLM.description:
Minimum allowable actual rate of climb during climb
segments (Default = 100.)

TMGLIM.description:
Minimum allowable thrust margin, (Thrust-Drag)/Drag,
during climb segments (Default = 0.1)

IG.description:
= 1, Ith behavioral constraint is used in
optimization (Default for first 7 constraints)
 = 0, Otherwise (Default for remaining constraints)

IBFGS.description:
= 0, Davidon-Fletcher-Powell (DFP) Algorithm
 = 1, Broyden-Fletcher-Goldfarb-Shano (BFGS) Algorithm
(Default)
 = 2, Conjugate Gradient (Polak-Ribiere) Algorithm
 = 3, Steepest Descent Algorithm
 = 4, Univariate Search Algorithm
(The above options use the FM penalty function)

ITFINE.description:
= 1, sets IRW = 1 for final analysis
 = 0, otherwise (Default)

NDD.description:
Number of drawdowns (Defaults to analysis only - no
optimization is performed.  Suggested value = 3 or 4)

RK.description: Initial value of RK (Default internally computed)

NLIN.description:
Maximum number of gradients per drawdown
(Default = number of active design variables times 2)

NSTEP.description:
Maximum number of steps per one-dimensional
minimization (Default = 20)

EF.description:
Limits one-dimensional minimization step size to EF
times previous step (Default = 3.)

EPS.description:
Fraction of initial design variable value used as a
finite difference delta (Default = .001)

AMULT.description:
The initial step in a one-dimensional search is
controlled by the design variable value times EPS
times AMULT (Default = 10.)

DEP.description:
One-dimensional search convergence criterion on step
size as a fraction of move distance (Default = .001)

ACCUX.description:
One-dimensional search convergence criterion on step
size as a fraction of initial design variable value
(Default = .0003)

GLM.description:
Value of G at which constraint switches to quadratic
extended form, a value of .002 is recommended
(Default = 0., no quadratic extension)

GFACT.description:
Scaling factor for Ith behavioral constraint
(Default = 1.)

AUTSCL.description:
Design variable scale factor exponent (Default =
1.00).  Scale factors for design variables default to
 VALUE ** AUTSCL

ICENT.description:
= 0, Forward differences will be used in gradient
calculations (Default)
 = 1, central differences will be used

RHOMIN.description:
Starting value for RHO, a scalar multiplying factor
used in the KS function.  (Default is computed
internally)

JPRNT.description:
KS module print control (Default = 2)
 = 0, No output from the KS module
 = 999, Maximum output (See reference 11)

RDFUN.description:
If the relative change in the KS function is less
than RDFUN for three consecutive iterations,
optimization is terminated. (Default = .01)

ADFUN.description:
If the absolute change in the KS function is less
than ADFUN for three consecutive iterations,
optimization is terminated. (Default = .001)

RerunLists.description: Group of namelist to be repeated vua RERUN

RERUN.description:
Data to Reanalyze a Sized or Optimized Configuration for an
Alternate Mission

MISSIN.description:
Performance Controls and Factors and Mission Segment Definition 
(Required if IANAL = 3 in Namelist $OPTION)

MISSIONDEFINITION.description:
Main Mission Flight Sequence Definition
(Required if IANAL = 3 in Namelist $OPTION)

allOf.description:
Data to Reanalyze a Sized or Optimized Configuration for an
Alternate Mission

MYWTS.description:
= 0, New weights will be computed
 = 1, Weights calculated previously during sizing or
optimization or the weights input below will be
used in the alternate mission analysis

RAMPWT.description: Gross weight before taxi out, lb

MLDWT.description:
= -1, The landing weight determined previously is not
scaled with changes in the gross weight.

ITAKOF.description:
= 0,  Turn off detailed takeoff performance
calculations

ILAND.description:
= 0,  Turn off detailed landing performance
calculations

NOPRO.description:
= 0,  Turn off detailed takeoff and climb profile
generation for noise calculations

IPLRNG.description:
Indicator for a point on a payload-range diagram
 = 0,  Normal RERUN operation (Default)
 = 1,  Use previously calculated OWE and Gross Weight
with maximum payload (PAYLMX)
 = 2,  Use previously calculated OWE and Gross Weight
with maximum fuel (FMXTOT)
 = 3,  Use previously calculated OWE with maximum fuel
(FMXTOT) and specified payload (paylod, above)
 = 4,  Use previously calculated OWE with maximum fuel
(FMXTOT) and zero payload
 = 5,  All of the above.  Generates 4 points on a
payload-range diagram.  The payload for point 3
is one half that calculated for point 2.
